content: Mostly fine, but there's been a long-standing bug (for YEARS) where, if you open the calculator after using it recently, it will appear blank, but then as soon as you start typing, whatever you had entered will reappear. It's easiest to just clear and start over, but it's annoying enough that I'm gonna look for alternatives... Something this dead simple should not annoy me to use.

I had no calculator app listed on my new phone, so I looked in PlayStore. Top of the list was advertised a simple app. I tried installing, but it opened to a link to TikTok, which started to play videos - so I uninstalled it from phone settings. I looked again in PlayStore, only to find that apparently there was a calculator already on my phone (perhaps transferred from my previous phone). I tested the calculator - in some ways better, scientific, but no memory function - I shall uninstall.

It's a functional calculator which is fine and I don't mind the layout. However, it's hard to find the history and I hate that there is no conversion option (for length, weight etc) which I have used extensively on other phones default calculators. It's fine but that's all I can say.

BUG on Pixel: If you enter some calculations into the calculator, lock screen and try to unlock it, you get black screen without fingerprint sensor icon. So you can't unlock screen. Until you repeat the the operation several times. Also should be an option to disable result as a fraction? Extra functions (sin, cos, etc.) are always hidden, should be an option to make them displayed by default. Long press on a delete button should delete the whole line.

Can't understand why Google doesn't make better apps. Not great calculator, now has"history" (memory) of previous results, but no conversion. I have a Samsung phone, and the calculator it's the brand default: Way better than this one. includes conversion. Not good enough. Uninstalled it.

Google Calculator may be simple, but it‚Äôs honestly one of the most useful tools on my phone. It‚Äôs fast, clean, and super easy to use with no ads, no clutter, just straight to the point. I use it all the time, whether I‚Äôm budgeting, cooking, or doing quick conversions. The layout is intuitive, and I really like the history feature that lets me scroll back through past calculations (super handy when I forget what I just did!). It‚Äôs lightweight, never crashes, and always there when I need it!!!

The Google calculator is nice. Sometimes it is good to have a digital calculator because it come in handy.Since when you don't have a physical calculator being able use a digital calculator is better alternative. The essential and vital thing you need a calculator for is for multiplication and division sometimes advanced math. The other vital and paramount reason you need a calculator is for money and finances. The other focus and thing I want to highlight is calculator useful for school.

very few calculators have the symbol that sits above/on the number 6 on a computer but this one has it. Only downer I have is when "clean history" is hit it deletes the screen sum as well. An older version of this is more easier to use though so this is only a "on the go " for me. The sums/answers run off the screen here but older version shrank digits and started next line. Much easier to detect mistakes, hence why this has 4 stars, I like sums and answers displayed at the same time.

Why has it changed so that you press = and it doesn't just give you the number you want to work off? It ends up giving you a full formula of what you've calculated except there is zero correct notation and would actually turn out as poor math. I can't believe a calculator app can be so bad, it's not got to be complicated or optimised to seem trendy. ITS A CALCULATOR

Simple, fast, and accurate! This calculator app is super easy to use and perfect for quick calculations. Whether it‚Äôs basic math or more advanced functions, it works flawlessly. Clean interface, no bugs, and no unnecessary ads‚Äîjust what I need. A must-have tool for everyday use! ‚ûï‚ûñ‚úñÔ∏è‚ûóüì±

The app is feasible to use and would be a better user experience with some changes. 1. The font size reduces as the calculations add on, good one. But scrolling left to right after completion of math for bigger calculations? I would prefer to see the whole calculation on the screen in 2 lines/3 lines. 2. It would be helpful if you could incorporate a unit converter, currency converter, instead of downloading a different app for conversions and reduce the usage of this app. Thanks.

Good smooth app. The history option is not accurate, I cannot usually find what I calculated. There should be an option to have the entire calculation displayed (in the space above the result) so that I can take a screenshot for reference.

I've been using this calculator regularly, and it's been a reliable tool for my everyday needs. It's fast, accurate, and easy to use, whether I'm doing basic arithmetic or more complex calculations. The interface is simple and intuitive, which makes it convenient for quick tasks. Overall, it's a helpful and efficient tool that gets the job done.

Been using this for years and never even looked into other calc apps since day one. It works for what I need on a day to day basis, has many other mathematical options for anyone that just has a calculator on their phone for basicd. I have never ran into a reason that doubts my using this app for so long!

It's alright, decently fun at first but gets old quick. I noticed that there are no female characters, might want to fix that, but there are no male characters either, so I guess it balances out. There is one bug if you use the arrow on the balloon, but other than that it's fine.

The latest update looks - and is - awful. The layout is far too big...bigger than necessary: it's very reminiscent of a toddler's toy called "My First Calculator"! I hate the way these kinds of apps are more-or-less "forced" on us. Update doesn't have any particularly useful new features, either. Suggest the dev. just reverts it back to a handy pocket calculator, other than something most people don't want or use much!

three dots menu is very poorly implemented. Instead of tiny text, how about use BROWSER type iconography, e.g., circular clock face instead of 'history ', a bin instead of 'delete', etc. Or a BIGGER menu so you can use font sizes above the current 4 point sized font? Still no improvement from original notification here in April 2024.

It's a calculator. It's not like it does anything special. Why do you need a rating???? If it talked back in a voice you could choose would be awesome but it doesn't. Just buttons you push and get a total. THE VOICE THING IS MY IDEA SO DON'T USE IT WITHOUT MY PERMISSION.!

Works great! Just wish it had some more features like Currency converter, length, weight, and so on. Maby it could be implemented as an "optional feature" that you choose what you want to install/download and use on the Calculator.

People, you need to update your reviews. Obviously Google was listening, because there's no "forced" sound or feedback anymore. My only complaint: As you enter calculations that exceed the display's width, there's a distracting "cute" animation where the font briefly gets bigger, then shrinks to the new size‚Ä¶ [EDIT:] Hey, they fixed that too! Thanks, Google‚Äîwe notice these things! üòäüëå

why does a calculator need and use: (under all permissions) have full network access view network connections prevent phone from sleeping measure app storage space read Google service configuration. The app says it needs no permissions. I removed network access and it complained. you can't even add numbers and have privacy.

How many people use their calculator for scientific functions? It displays calculations as fractions instead of decimals and there's no way to change it. Useless to the 99% of people who use their calculator for simple accounting functions. Great for your high school trig class though.

This is an amazing app which I love the most. It helps me to calculate different staffs and also solving probability of higher proportions. Calculator can also be used as a hide out of your own private properties in your device.

This is the worst calculator app I've had. I don't need to see my results as fractional expression every time. But I would like to see my history without having to press a button every time. Sometimes I really wish Samsung made their apps available for other devices, because some of Google's really suck.

Simple, fast, and reliable ‚Äî the perfect calculator app! Whether it's basic math or quick percentage calculations, this app handles it all smoothly. The interface is clean and easy to use, with no ads or distractions. A must-have utility for everyday use!

Calculators are essential tools for math, science, finance, and everyday calculations. Calculators provide quick and accurate calculations. Calculators save time compared to manual calculations. Calculators come in basic, scientific, graphing, and financial types for different needs.

The update ruined the calculator. Maybe the real game for the updaters is getting the most bad reviews makes you the winner. It really looks like that to me. Why else would they want to change something we all loved? I have yet to see any update that you make that improves any app. I dread all the updates bc they screw up whatever was previously perfect. I waste a lot of time uninstalling what was updated & searching for replacements. simply ridiculous.

Calculator apps vary widely in features and user experience. Some are simple, ad-supported apps for basic arithmetic, while others offer advanced scientific functions, history tracking, and customization options. A good calculator app should be intuitive, reliable, and provide a clear display

this simple app installed on my Google pixel 7a phone, just crashed my phone, my entire phone stopped functioning for 10 minutes and no swipe action or on off combination of buttons could make my phone useable again. i had to remove my SIM card for many minutes to regain access to my phone, using Wi-Fi and the no service read out.

It used to be great, it was my go to calculator for all my uses. When not in an exam at least. It gave me every option for manual inputs when performing calculations. Why can't I have individual brackets? Now they've changed it made it more simple and vastly more frustrating. You could at least enable me to have the option to use the previous, superior, layout.

It looks like a cheap child's calculator, and less information is shown as calculations progress. The back/delete key is in an awkward place. No doubt the develope's view is "we'll get used to it" but why should we have to? OK, redesign the look, but keep the layout and usability the same, for goodness' sake. Overall a regressive and unwanted change.

the only reason I didn't give five stars for this app, although I find it extremely useful. I like to look at the history and apply it to whatever calculations I need. However, it would be so nice if you allowed it to have a place for notations in the history next to each calculation as an option. thanks

The worst calculator I've ever seen. Poor UI, no inversion, no reciprocal key, no repeating last operation on equal key, no repeating delete last character on holding delete key, only square root, wrong notation, no scientific mode, no decent history, no converter.

What the h--l did they do to this? In would think it'd be practically impossible to ruin a simple calculator app, but they certainly have! Vibrates twice on every button press, once when you touch it, once when you let go and NO way to change this behavior, weird, clunky, slow way of saving and recalling numbers from memory, I mean, come on, it's a CALCULATOR. Not rocket surgery.

Extra useful, however, I believe it should be a default integral part of any device, the way it was before the development of internet phones (smartphones), and it shouldn't be a separate application.

lost the history every time when I closed the application and on reopen, nothing there in history. you need to improve this, every one has this expectation. in my old mobile realme it has history for ages which helped me a lot. hope you are also make necessary changes to store history until manually clear all the history. Hoping I will get a response ASAP. thankyou.
I cannot imagine life without this app as it helps me calculate anytime and anywhere to calculate anything i want to at all hours of the day without carrying a caculator in my hand or bag at all.
Great precision and speed. The history is harder to use than in One Calculator. There is no obvious way to do log base 2.

I can't uninstall this app and it doesn't make sense to me literally when I click numbers and I press one of the signs the numbers kind of disappear and when I press new numbers it's just showing different numbers I don't get it a lot like how do you use this thing literally when you press numbers and you press the sign and press new numbers it's just showing different numbers like when I press the equal sign it's that number I'm only 10 and I have dyslexia I don't know if I'm right thank you.

I used to really really like using a calculator, but ever since this new update everything is screwed up. I'm very passionate about my numbers, I find the update has made the calculator substantially worse, considerably more ugly, and a lot more buggy. Often past equations overlap with a little indicator on the top that shows when I'm in degrees or radians. It was absolutely no reason for the change, I wish there was a way to bring the old one back.

the app is great! But you need to add more useful features like currency converter, apple already has this! I know one will need internet for that so it be that way. Please add the currency converter feature.
excellent calculator. Works like a charm. extremely lightweight. easy to navigate minimal impact to battery in memory. highly recommended.

The old interface was great, simple, easy to use. I opened up the app and was confused after the recent update. At first, since it looked so different, I thought it was maybe a different app. I have had the screen part (vs the number and symbol part) scroll somewhere I can't see the calculations. The new design is frustrating vs intuitive and easy to read. Somehow they made a calculator annoying to use. Can't even uninstall it and now it's going to my bloatware folder.

Worst calculator I've ever used. I frequently have to redo lengthy calculations because it unintuitively wipes out results. How does something so bad continue to exist? Deserves fewer than zero stars.
I like that it can handle large numbers. I don't like the lack of bases, no scientific calcs, no history, and the way the font size keeps changing.
This is a handy basic pre-installed calculator app. it will do all basic calculations and a little more. wow this is perfect for a average user, I prefer a different app

Mike, moto g13 plus running Android 14 Date, 08/06/25 Most Google apps are starting to look like the colour scheme and animations were provided by Fisher Price, but that doesn't affect the way the app works. This app does what I need it to do, so it's ok.

I tried to use this when I was studying for a math test and I was confused about the numbers only to realize one question wasn't right am I hand it into my teacher she's like you got a question wrong on your notes and so I'm like what it should be right I checked now there is a problem wrong right here went at number 7 and I start freaking out because that's the hardest question on the paper. ü´©
Why can't this calculator do PEMDAS, or BODMAS depending on where you were taught? Casio calculators have done this since the 1980s, maybe earlier, it seems like a simple thing to fix.
I don't like the way when you hit equal to get your answer it gives it to you in a fraction not a decimal like most calculators and I'm not sure how to fix it or if I even can fix it

I love this app it also ads Free This calculator is fantastic I appreciate its simplicity, and if that's what you're after, you absolutely have to download this app. You'll be glad you did Thanks Google‚ù§Ô∏è
i expected more from Google, this calculator is way too simple, it lacks useful features like conversion and looks bad.

Hi I just want to give a shout out to you guys for being the best app I can never asked for it's always working smoothly always making my iPad work well and I'm so blessed to have this app because you know a lot of apps for calculators don't even work so I'm so happy that you guys made this app and I will be recommending this to everybody I see you know about this so I want you guys to continue what you got is hard work because this app is paying off your customer service is and stuff so thanks

Every time I use this app and my display turns off, it locks up my phone when I turn the display back on and unlock my device. I have trouble getting out of the calculator app all together. I am uninstalling this app.

It's a Google calculator, it calculated Google's, not Mathematics, so I installed ClevCalc, this is a True Blue Normal and Scientific Calculator, half the size and twice as smart... Wish it were possible to remove this one, even though I left out the Google Calculator in the fresh install, here it is, it's STILL HERE, AARRGGHH...

my calendar has proven to me that I can no longer do math without it I can't even do a simple 800 - 345 but I could always count on my calculator always tell me the truth and exactly what the answer is you can count on your calculator it won't do you wrong
All of a sudden you can't swipe up to see your open apps with the calculator. You have to go to the home screen then swipe up. it just keeps bouncing back.
Please add an option to disable scientific notation for results that contain multiple zeros. I'd rather see all the digits.

I think mines broke because I don't think it knows how to add ..I don't think Google should preinstall so many redundant apps especially when you don't want them and then like myself with storage issues

I love this app! The interface is excellent and seamlessly adapts to my One UI customization. The buttons are large, and the text is appropriately sized and very user-friendly. No complaints here, it's awesome!
Would score higher if it did conversations such as lbs to kg, or miles io kilometers. The higher math functions are not day to day usage for me or the average person.

I really liked this calculator prior to this last update. It's confusing and looks completely different. I was just balancing my checkbook and had added 40+ entries and hit = instead of +. I could not go back and correct the sign like I could before. I now have to start over. Give us the other one back please! The update did not add anything beneficial to the app.

I don't like this latest update. Now, if you're calculating a string of numbers, it does not show you a running list of what your calculations are. It only shows you your updated total. If I'm balancing the checkbook, I can't see the exact number that I just entered into the calculator, so I could easily make a mistake because I'm not seeing the latest number being entered. Update: now it IS showing a string of numbers. I don't know what I did different!!

I'm chiming in with my first ever app review. I hate the new update! It's bland with poorly defined buttons which makes it difficult for me to use. And there's no way to go back to the original display. My choice is a light theme (yuck!) or a dark theme (double yuck!). Think I'll download a different app that's easier on the eyes. Which brainiac came up with this brilliant concept? Big mistake, Google!

INV DOESN'T WORK: AS IN INV 5 ISN'T 5, OR 5 INV ISN'T 5 OR INV 5 = ISN'T 5. I can't figure out how to get what should be a simple thing to work. I realize I might not be entering it in a format it likes but without any other instructions....

Not a calculator I have been using this app for years and it was fantastic. For some reason the developers decided that they are smarter than everyone else and instead of a User Interface like a calculator they made some creative "enhancements" to make it "easier" to use. Sure it might be easier to use for someone that has never used a calculator before, or was clueless in how to actually use the calculator. However they forgot about muscle memory. If you aren't an idiot then skip this app.

I hate the new update. Please change it back to how it was. My main problem is you can't hold down the back button to delete all of it, anymore. Now, you have to click it every single time to delete all the numbers or symbols one at a time. I know it doesn't sound like a big deal, but I'm in surgery most of the day and always in a rush. I use this calculator to figure out dosages for animals so being able to hold the back button down to delete a previous calculation really saves me alot of time.

Hate it!! Would love to give this a "0" stars. I prefer the old format. This looks childish. People should be able to choose how they want it to appear on their phones. There should be a spot in the "choose theme" area where you can choose the original format. People get accustomed to where buttons/keys are. I make more mistakes now because it's not a familiar set up and as far as I'm concerned, I don't think it flows well like this. GIVE ME THE ORIGINAL BACK!!!

The old design was so much better than the update. I don't know why they took away some of the most useful functionality of the calculator (like being able to clear the whole expression rather than one character at a time). Much of the more advanced functionality was taken away. It much more laggy than it used to be. It seems that every character I type takes a long time to register. Nothing about the update is better and I am hoping they just revert back to the old version.

I don't know when it happened but after using this simple app infrequently for years, they have decided to default to giving answers in fractions. I can't for the life of me understand why anyone in the world would find this helpful, they are just copying Casio default options, which are also nonsense. It has never had any complex uses but I pretty much use it to calculate discounts on the go, or other such basic calculations. Now it doesn't work for that.

Was the best calculator app I've ever used up until about a week ago, when the update drastically changed the visuals and moved controls around. Now you can't simply swipe from the right to get scientific calculator functions, you have to click a little down arrow. Brackets are automatic, which functions, but is more confusing. Overall, the update made it much less intuitive.

I used to love this calculator! So easy to use, very responsive, simple and intuitive layout. But then someone somewhere decided it needed an update. Awful So slow, so unsightly; I hope desperately that they revert back to the previous version. I don't want to have to find a replacement when this one was everything I wanted in a phone calculator.

I used this calculator all the time and was quite pleased with it, UNTIL they "updated" "improved" "changed" it. It is no longer as easy to see or to use. I am not happy at all with the "new improved" version. I want my old calculator back. Seems like since we pay for the phones and pay for the service, we should have the option of keeping the versions we are used to and prefer. Y'all did the same thing with Gallery and Camera. New isn't better.

So what,a basic calculator,doesn't need continuous update, it's not like it will do anything new, with amazing features added, update eats away at memory without customized options,get over yourself,far more apps baked into phone that need repair or upgrade, ability to delete ,what exactly are the bug fixes and improvements? Works and looks exactly like it did 3 years ago,same yesterday, today and tomorrow ,so what then,so what now,at least give some personality.
Can not get rid of the fraction! This is driving me crazy. I just want to use it with our being shown a fraction. There are No INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO CHANGE IT AND IT IS DRIVING ME MAD.

I don't like the changes you've made in this calculator app. This would not be an accountant's favorite. I don't use a calculator very often but this one gets a ZERO! The decimal point should always be in the right hand bottom corner to be standard. Why can't you be consistent with a standard 10 key? The color scheme is harder on eyes. Keep it basic like you had it before. Why change something that didn't need fixing?

It was super useful and easy to read, I always used it as opposed to the one on my iPad simply because of the layout, but they changed it, it's like they were trying to copy iOS, the icon doesn't even match with the actual app, not only that but you have to tap multiple times or press the AC button (which took me forever to find btw) to delete everything rather than holding down on the delete button, you also can't preview answer anymore. It's hard to use and even look at.

This isn't just a calculator; it's a beautifully designed app that seamlessly blends simple and advanced mathematical functions. It's intuitive, sleek, and a perfect example of functional Material Design.

Now looks like a pastel child's toy. Instead of the current calculation stacking, it now displays on a single line of such large friendly numbers that it can't all be seen as you work. And the putative result doesn't show until you press the =button. That was a feature I found really useful and it's gone. First clock, and now calc. Are all your apps going to turn into bubblegum? And then I tried landscape. The font size changes to fill the frame! A calculator with no idea of number position!

AMAZING I LOVE IT it's the best calculator ever it helped me calculate lots of stuff idk why ppl rate it 1 star and be mean about it? it's literally the best calculator I ever saw/used. it's never laggy like other ones. so I rated this 5 stars and it's absolutely deserved. thank you google and the people that made this!

Screenshots provided are of old interface, which looked half professional. The new interface looks as if it were aimed at 2-year olds. Whose idea was it to introduce themes but not allow one to retain the old theme? That aside, the calculator is surprisingly good. It isn't merely functional; it also reports exact answers on many occasions where it could get away with approximations. For example, fractions are often displayed along with decimals, and it will even do sin(œÄ/3) correctly! Nice!

Really inconvenient in so many ways! For instance (but not limited to), in that you cannot copy the whole expression into clipboard at once. Like, "5+3*8=29". You can copy either "5+3*8" or "29". Otherwise, nothing special. Given how old is the idea of a calculator, I'd have expected something way more handy a refined from probably the world greatest software company üòä
pls improve or It would be very useful if there was a button that would allow you to instantly check the value of foreign currency.

The update makes the keyboard vibrate twice in rapid succession per key press, and it's absolutely alarming, overstimulating, and overwhelming. I hope it's a bug that is fixed ASAP, but if someone is trying to make it like a physical button clicking down and clicking back up, please know that many users will find this horrific and antagonist, and please allow us to turn it off. I can't use it currently. Thanks.

The app was fine until the recent update. Now, you can no longer clear the formula bar by holding the delete key. You have to tap it for each numerical character. It literally takes less time to close the app and reopen it. I've never felt the need to replace the default Google calculator app until now, but they just had to mess with something that didn't need to be messed with. So stupid.

This used to be a great calculator for calculating and editing complex operations, trying out different variables for the same problem Now they remade the UI, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but they also shuffled the buttons, making it harder to use and breaking muscle memory. Also, there is now a unified parenthesis button, meaning that if you want to put w(x(y+z) you have to put w(x)(y+z) and erase one parenthesis, which is really annoying

Why was any change made to this application? It's a tool. Features have literally been removed for the sake of "style". The calculator no longer shows the answer to the equation as you type it, holding the delete button doesn't clear the screen, and it doesn't give you the fraction form of decimals anymore. No one asked for an update for the calculator, it was perfectly fine before.
it is not proper calculator. need add on option area,length,time,loan amount,date,mass,and etc you can see xoami phone calculator.mi calculator is perfect calculator.

Finally was able to update the app without finding it changing the UI from the way I prefer it. Thanks for not forcing it on us. Good app, otherwise. I use it all the time, which means I like it the way it is.

I just got a pixel 9 pro xl and this calculator interface is atrocious. I see from others the layout used to be smaller? Why is it so large and uncomfortable? I'm going back to my Samsung calculator app dude.

Am I the only person who just needs a basic calculator with a built in, simple way of converting lengths, volumes and weights etc? This is a big step down from my old default Samsung calculator. It tries to act like Einstein but looks like Mr Tumble.
Why is the decimal point at the center when every other calc has it on the mid right side. keeps messing input. At least give an option to reconfigure.

Does not have repeat function where you press the equal sign multiple times to repeat the calculation with the latest output. All analog calculators have that, so does iPhones' calculator...why don't you?
Does not have any conversion capability (length, currency, weight, etc) like every other phone calculator I've ever used.

Like everyone else, I despise the newest update and will be installing a different calculator app. Not having a running total while entering numbers without hitting the equals key is ridiculous. Who thought putting the back button at the bottom was a good idea? In addition, holding the back button no longer clears the calculator, which is just another thing devs broke. Frustrating.

Absolute trash.,. They changed it to absolute trash. I run multiple businesses, I use the calculator all day long to figure different aspects of my business with finance. And now they made it nearly intolerable to be able to do quick calculations. This new format changed to the calculator is the worst thing that they could have possibly done to this app. At least give us the option in the app to go back to the classic design.

Sure it still works, but why did you feel the need to take a nice sharp professional looking calculator and turn it into some weird bubble popping simulator. This isn't a social network, you're not trying to engage users with fancy designs, it's a calculator. Keep it simple. Edit: I had given this a 3 star, but I was so wrong about the functionality. You somehow succeeded in making a calculator hard to use. This is more a toy than a tool now.

It's been the perfect calculator app until today. Until someone decided to make it "nicer" and "better". This is how everything good dies in this world. The new design is rubbish, please lynch whoever did the graphics. The numbers are too big and if I need to add twenty numbers I want to see the whole n1+n2+...+n20 expression in order to check for typos etc. Instead I can admire "adorable" buttons. So long and thx for all the fish

It was fine. Nothing spectacular, but a simple calculator doesn't have to be fancy. However, after the recent update all the buttons are set to "blind grandparent" size, like if you went to your accessibility settings and selected "visually impaired". My screen's 6.6" and the 5 rows of buttons take up almost 5". For serious? One-handed days are a distant memory.

It's a simple, clean, intuitive app that doesn't try to be too much. There's one BUG though: After typing a number or equation of length 14 (including operators and commas), the expression area temporarily becomes blank leaving only the last 2 of the 14 characters, but they all re-appear upon adding another digit or operator to make the current expression/number length 15 or greater. It is a little annoying at times, but nonetheless, this is my ideal CALCULATOR.

The interface that came with the new update is awful. They've moved buttons around so it's no longer intuitive, I'm constantly accidentally hitting the equals button before I'm ready and then having to start over, it won't show sums until I hit equals when I use it in split-screen mode (which I used to regularly do while doing my monthly budgeting), split screen mode buttons are so small they're near impossible, I could go on and on. Hope they change it back asap.

I never thought I would be leaving a review for a calculator, but here we are. The new update is awful; the buttons are huge and have been rearranged, you can't long-press the delete button to clear, the buttons are huge, and it has become less user-friendly in general. I am trying to see if I can "roll back" to the previous version, otherwise I will be uninstalling.

The update to the latest version of this app, had the fonts changed to where they can be very difficult to recognize. The previous version had much more legible fonts and coloring on their displays. Contrast that with the current version, where if you don't have 20/20 vision, you will probably have difficulty recognizing the various buttons in the app. As a side note, I'm disappointed that Google doesn't have anybody experience working on their app displays. A large segment of the population doe

Like others have mentioned, the backspace button cannot be held to quickly clear your entry, so you have to mash the backspace multiple times in order to clear the field. Furthermore, the backspace button is in an odd location, it should be further and up to the right so that is easy and intuitive to access (most all other calculators use this format.) The blue color scheme is hard on the eyes and leads to more eye fatigue and restless nights than warmer, orange/red tones. Blessings.
Switch apps button is disabled, close the app the phone is locked, home out of app it crashes. Pretty bad!
it would be nice if it could do more complex maths like algebra, solving equations, matrices etc.

Something very strange it's going on with this app. When I open my quick settings and pull down to see the calculator quick setting icon it turns off really fast. It shouldn't have been on in the first place. No joke it does it almost every time it's like I sneak up on it and it's lit up green. As soon as I get the screen pulled down enough to start seeing the icons the calculator app will shut off really quickly. It feels like I just caught it cheating on me. Strange! Uninstalling

Why change features of app.? New format is awful! Cant see all numbers as you are entering calculation formular. It was very beneficial to enter numbers with formula and also see the results (total) as you continue with calculation. Should NOT have to press enter to see results. More accuracy if you can see on going total as you enter more numbers. Please change it back!!! to original version. It suited everone's n√©eds. If not, I hope I can find a more user friendly calcular app.
Best. I hope you add special features too, such as making custom functions and simple algorithms.
It asks for Settings Per missions it doesn't need. Why would it need Location, Phone, and SMS permissions, etc? It's like a spy app in my opinion - hence the one star!

Update switch to Mobi Calculator You even moved the clear button!!! I don't like the update. We were used to the old form now we've got a figure out where the buttons are because someone had the bright idea of change it. I just need a simple calculator. The other one did that and still had the bells and whistles for people who need to do real calculations. Updating an app means fixing things not doing a complete overhaul and move buttons and functions that we were used to and liked.

This is the only review I've ever left about an app on the Google store. I have used this calculator for work and school for years, and the latest update ruined it. There is an annoying vibration with every touch. It no longer displays the answer prior to pressing "=". No options for open/closed parenthesis. Also, new UI sucks. Please at least add the option to use the old version of the calculator.
plus, minus and other operator symbols are so sensitive that they are not responding and have to repress them to get reflected on the display.
Simple. it's missing unit conversion capabilities. Apple native app does unit conversion, why is this app so far behind?
you should add a floating widget it helps us to do a calculations on other messeging apps otherwise we have to open and close the window again n again
Improvement Suggession: in this should have minimalising/split screen feature so I can use calculator using another App also!
I dont want to watch long ads when trying to calculate my bills, each time!!! THIS IS NOT FOR ME, SO IM UNINSTALLING IT
Best and useful tools for mathematics, also include scientific symbols when doing calculations
I can't open the app to use it now, I was using it 2 seconds ago now it wont work. since my phone updated I can't use it. üò°üò°
Worthless app. it doesn't always open. How is that possible with just a simple calculator?

Helpful to keep track of expenses and keeping to the budget. New changes have made edits to transactions less user friendly. Setting up a new budget (like for my wedding) was frustrating because I couldn't figure out how to add it from my phone. I had to use my laptop. Once the budget was added, everything was easy. I like being able to look at past trends with expenses, add cash purchases, and split transactions into multiple budgets as needed. Super helpful app.

Re-modifying review. Thanks for reaching out, for no reason, it seems to not require disabling the ad blocker anymore. Must have been a bad gravity or something. Not your fault! Original review: "Very simple to use, with automatic transaction tracking and categorizing. Makes excellent use of budgets, which makes it very easy to find out exactly where your money is going, at a glance. It does also have a weird quirk where it will assign random categories to certain regular purchases though."
replyContent: Hi Peter, We are happy your overall experience with Mint has been positive and we appreciate you leaving your feedback. As for the latest update and issue with ad-blocking, our teams would like to investigate what exactly is happening in greater detail. Please see our Facebook/Twitter pages or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC. -Andrew

content: I was looking forward to trying out the visual redesign but was sorely disappointed. The switch to card navigation with 6+ cards is very confusing. I never know where the specific info is that I'm looking for. The vertical layout was so much more user friendly. Another issue is the lack of UI polish. It seems like you shipped a pre Alpha version. Edges are rough, graphs are jagged and the resolution on some images looks way too low. Most importantly, the brutal use of ads. They are everywhere!

Mint was a great app/website. Sure it wasn't perfect but I used it for a decade. The move to credit karma was horrible. It was invasive, my identity has been stolen so I had to unfreeze my credit to even get credit karma?! It's tied to too much "real identity" info and my credit reports (instead of just account log-ins that I can easily change if they get compromised). This is 100% unnecessary for what I wanted to use it for. And it didn't even transfer everything. Time to start over elsewhere.

Update: I used to have zero issues with the app, but some changes were made and now I'm experiencing more problems. I added two bills last month for monthly reminders. I'm positive I set it up right. I checked for those bills this week, and of course they're nowhere to be found. I added them AGAIN. 2) I can only view bills due within 25 days. I used to love this app. It's getting to the point of being a hassle, opposed to being a help. üò©

2024: What a bad decision to discontinue Mint! Previously: This app is gold! I use it for just about everything... budgeting, tracking, credit score, etc. Simple to use and effective for staying in "the black". One fix I'd like to see is it updating faster - it does take a while to update the accounts and sometimes it doesn't show pending items even though the individual account shows it from their end.

For heaven's sakes run before you hit the install button. I tried it a few years ago but didn't have the patience to set it up. So I've spent probably 10 hours this week trying to get it all tidied up. Then I find out that the beautiful budget I made has to be re-entered every month. You can carry totals over but you have to enter each item in every month. So, if you like typing A LOT {I have 28 different "budgets"} and have far more Patience than I do by all means hit "install".

The Credit Karma move is horrible. It's no longer helpful for budgeting or tracking non linked cash or bill expenses. I liked the old layout where I could see everything at a glance. Now it's all mumbled. Also, my bank will not connect with this program because it doesn't meet their minimum security protections.... please fix that. What's the point of setting a passcode if you continually ask for the email and password?

The app is quick to show you that your credit needs help but once you do what it says, it is super slow to acknowledge the positive changes. It suggested that I pay a specific amount in order to increase my score, so I paid more than it suggested, but after 2 months, the system still has NOT acknowledged my efforts!!! As in most things, it is quick to point out negatives but it takes forever for the positive changes to be recognized!!! CREDIT IS A SCAM... USE CASH, IT KILLS THE GREEDY PEOPLE'S C
replyContent: Hi there, We want to assure you that we want your finances and credit to prosper. Your credit details come from TransUnion, one of the 3 major credit reporting bureaus. If there are issues or you'd like to make a dispute, we encourage you to contact them. If you need further help with your concerns, see our Facebook/Twitter pages. -Andrew

content: I have been using Mint for awhile and loved it. Recently they keep updating the app and each time it gets worse. At first it would just take awhile for the accounts to refresh, which was annoying, but doable. This last one I was forced to do a few days ago is absolutely horrible. It took me 2 days to get into my account after the update and once I did none of my account would show up. Now I'm back to not being able to login.
replyContent:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to submit a review. We understand your frustration. Please try reinstalling the app to fix this issue. If the problem persists please reach out to our chat support here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB

content: While I wish there were fewer credit card ads or a way to opt out (especially when paying down debt), Mint is pretty good as a wealth aggregator. I have been a member (website then app) for 10+ years and I check the app daily. I like to see my accounts in one place and track my progress. Customer service is great too, the lady helped so fast I regretted taking so long to call. I also sounds like a great company, I may actually want to work there when I grow up ;)

i love using mint. it's fast and user-friendly and makes budgeting a breeze. i appreciate the UI rollback. two things - can you look at the account refresh? when i log in, my account "refreshes," but only in wasted time. i have to redo it every time. second, I'd like a filter for transactions. create a rule based on the transaction amount (i.e.: a $5 charge in the work cafeteria is fast food, not internet). thanks!!

I use to love this app. But with the recent update they took out the nifty calendar that was helpful in viewing incoming money and what needed to be paid. But what I hate the most is my accounts need to be "fix" or have a "message" and event if I put in the correct user name and password, and view the message, the accounts cannot be updated. I tried removing them and re-adding them and it doesn't work. The app is useless to me now.

BETA Version needs work. PRO Can set up and track a lot of accounts including banks, credit cards, utility bills and more. CONS If your bank, loan or credit card is not supported you can't put in a current balance, credit limit, available balance, track debits or credits, and there is no way to import a CSV. until the cons above are fixed this app should be advertised as a beta test release. Without the ability to track unsupported accounts, this app is useless to me.

Edit-I've uprated from 2*. The app has evolved into a very useful and usable tool. No more rants. Old review follows--[Intuit bought an outstanding finance and payment app named Check renamed to Bills only to kill it and try to convince us that the Mint app is a better replacement. I've tried my best, but what a disaster. I ended up paying a $513 bill twice because Mint didn't think I needed to pay anything and it wasn't clear how to force a payment. Now I just was hit with $34 in late payment fees on another account where I thought I correctly scheduled a payment. Everything was so easy with Bills. I'm only using Mint to check my transactions and status now.]

It's okay, but there are issues. The biggest, however, is lack of support for other currencies (seriously - internet shopping is a thing now, folks), and the other huge issue is the inability to remove duplicate transactions. If my checking account and my PayPal account are both linked to mint, everything shows up in duplicate (or even triplicate). If a transaction is in FX, Mint treats the foreign currency as USD (good times when buying stuff denominated in Japanese yen, e.g.).
replyContent: Hello Tina! We appreciate you taking the time to submit your feedback and suggestions! We are always looking for ways to improve our app. We would love to hear if there are any additional improvements that need to be addressed. Please reach out to our support team on Facebook/Twitter. Thank you for being an awesome Minter! -April

content: This cannot handle unique transaction names in their category rules. For example, if Netflix bills me as "Netflix 1/1/22" one month then Netflix "2/1/22" next month it treats those as unique... So one month it might go in "utilities" and the next month as "bills". Customer service was unhelpful. This is a deal breaker, because I don't want to edit every transaction individually to put it in the right category for budgeting. I like the rest of the app...
replyContent:
Hi Lynn, thank you for your feedback. We understand that it can be frustrating when a unique ID will not apply to a rule. We know that it is important to be able to accurately track your finances for better financial health and appreciate that you have shared this with us. It is customer feedback like yours that helps us to improve.
-Erin

content: I've been using Mint inconsistently for about 3 years but everytime I use I'm happy. They only frustrating thing (but I guess it is good security so I can't be too mad) is the constantly having to log into my accounts through Mint especially when I'm in one of my strides and consistently using it and have to log into some account every few days. Also, I noticed my credit score was way off but so are all my other credit score apps (actual credit was much higher).
replyContent: Hi Mikayla, Your security is very important to us. We want you to continue to use Mint in confidence. If you have a concern regarding the frequency of reconnecting your account, please reach out to a support agent for further assistance. We can be reached on Facebook, Twitter or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC Thank you for using Mint! -Minh

content: I just got it, and so far I quite enjoy the precision of the app in tracking expenses. I have, however, noted something that is going to annoy me very much very quickly; I am unable to add categories of my own. I think it's very important to allow users to be as specific as possible in their expenses, and I really don't think it's a terribly difficult addition. Also, being able to see what is in my debit and savings account separately would be great. Serious oversight there. Great app tho.
replyContent: Hi Lisa, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and suggestion. Although you are not able to make changes to the main categories, you are still able to add and edit subcategories by following these steps https://bit.ly/321cPzE You can also make rules for categorization by following the instructions here https://bit.ly/39vJGyS -Minh

content: This used to be powerful in its simplicity, intuitive and easy to use. Now all its features are scattered around, difficult to find or figure out how to use. For instance, I want to see all transactions in a specific category; I finally found where the categories are, but it's only the the main category, I searched for a long time to find where I can sort by the sub-categories and I still havent found it.
replyContent: Hi Aron. We appreciate you reaching out. That feature can be found on the website version under "Trends". If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us via Facebook, Twitter, or online chat: https://intuit.me/3WqylcN so that we can assist you best. Thank you for being a valued member of the Mint family! - Mary

content: Ok experience, far from impressive. Search on mobile (Samsung) is actually terrible, you should be able to search a word and have it bring up all transactions that match... Not how this works. Also, would be nice to hard code a transaction category even when it is still pending, this would be A HUGE improvement. Only reason I stick with it is because I trust Intuit.
replyContent: Hi Beau. We appreciate you reaching out with your excellent suggestions regarding the search capabilities and pending transactions. We'd like to invite you to leave direct feedback about the app here: https://intuit.me/3K0qbnQ so that our development team can review it for potential application in future updates. Thank you for using Mint. - Mary

content: Butchered by the most recent update. They've changed what used to be a master home screen with a clean, to-the-point overview of your information, and split it into 5 pages. 1 of those 5 screens is a full-page ad, and the other 4 have what I can only describe as blocky headlines that take up half the screen, that you then have to dig into to find any real detail. They are also littered with links to additional ads. I will be moving to another app to track my finances.
replyContent: We truly appreciate you taking the time to provide your feedback.  We have noted this and will provide it to the product team for further review.

content: Edit: I liked Mint but it's no longer functional for me because it cannot connect to some bank accounts. I already tried contacting support about this over the years and they still haven't been able to fix it. // Helpful. I like the pie charts but please allow us to review the charts from past months. Please also add a widget which allows quick adding of expenses / income. Right now the widgets contain too much personal info (e.g. your total cash) to put on your phone screen.
replyContent:
Hi Ellen,
We are sad to hear that Mint is not functioning for you and you have not reached a resolution. We appreciate your willingness to reach out to our support team and we hope that you will reach out to our team on Facebook, Twitter, or via chat https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC when you are ready to give us another chance to further investigate.
-Minh

content: The new redesign is awful. It takes so much longer to see your information, because now you have to swipe a million times instead of everything being on one page. Worse yet, the calculations are now wrong, particularly on the cash flow tab. I had to log in to the computer version to get the accurate numbers, making the app a waste of time. I hope they fix this.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We have rolled back the recent interface changes. Thanks for your patience while we work on this.

content: I had given it a 5 star rating and used it for years, but lately (the past few months) I've had duplicate accounts, which I marked as duplicate and eventually deleted because marking it as duplicate didn't change anything, and I've had to re-enter my amount information multiple times, and one of my accounts still doesn't update (data is 6 wks old) even though login info is correct. The app, my phone, and my info is up to date. Today, it won't even let me log in. ("Error returned from client"?)
replyContent:
Hi Jenny, we appreciate your feedback! To mark a duplicate account as inactive, Mint will show its balance as zero and it‚Äôll stop updating: https://intuit.me/3OlM4Qe For duplicate transactions: https://intuit.me/44OSgWg We would be happy to assist you with your login concerns, as well as account connectivity, here: https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX
-Erin

content: So helpful! The only reason I don't give this five stars is because sometimes the app can take a while to load correct information, and maybe also because I would like a function where you can customize a budget title. If this app is used consistently and you honestly map out a budget of everything you spend (wants and needs) each month, you will not be able to say "I don't know where my money is going".

The app could use some theming options, especially a dark mode. Other than that, Mint is still the best budgeting app in my opinion and also the cheapest despite the bloated features such as credit card offers. Ad-free for a dollar is way better than the competition. If you use TurboTax, Credit Karma, etc. it's even better because you only have to give your information to one company, which has better data security than the competition as well. No Plaid or third party services required.
replyContent: Hey Chase, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're glad to see that Mint's interconnectivity to other products, ad-free option, and budgeting has helped you keep track of your financials smoothly. That's our goal! We appreciate your feedback so we can continue to grow and improve. Thanks for being the best part of Mint! -Amber

content: Great! I would give it a 5 but it's missing the budget and calendar views in the mobile app. I think the budget view should be the default view. When you login to the app you want to quickly see what's paid and what not pad and what is available in your account. But otherwise, I love the bill alerts, suggestions etc. And it's all free!
replyContent: Hey there Chuck, thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback with us. We love getting suggestions for users like you! We work hard to make the experience as best as we can. We will certainly take a look at the request you provided here. Thank you for being an awesome Minter! -Brycen

content: One of the silver linings to this "Great Rest" that we are all in now, and the subsequent paycut I took, was that I finally needed/had to get my finances in order. I was hoping that an app (and even better desktop website) already existed that could help and also be fairly no frills. This app was a great entr√© to reining in my spending by allowing me to set budgets and see transax9. App gets 4 stars only bc website has more options for setting and editing budgets.

Sure, it's good for budgeting, but it's terrible for tracking data over any period longer than a month. For example, there is no way to find out how much charity I spent in 2022. The data is all there but mint will not aggregate it for me. I literally need to search for every charity transaction and add them up. Also, mint is often terrible at categorizing. Any payments through Zelle and PayPal are booked as "transfer" and do not count toward budgeted expenses!
replyContent:
Hi David, we appreciate your feedback! To manage your transaction categories and subcategories: https://intuit.me/3aAsTkb To view a specific transaction type, such as your charitable donations: https://intuit.me/3KO6gHg You can also search for transactions within a certain timeframe, here: https://intuit.me/410p3WJ Thanks for choosing Mint!
-Erin

content: I have been using Mint for about 3 years. 1st couple of years it was amazing. But, now half of my accounts have disconnected. I tried to reconnect, then it said there was a connection error. Tried to put a complaint in, then it said there was a connection error. Its annoying when i have to manually enter my bill due dates.

overall a great app. Really eye opening to get all our accounts in one place and see how we've been spending wastefully. Gripes: Random categorizations. Gas becomes restaurants. I transfer money to an investment account and it calls it auto expenses and throws our budget target way off instead of reading it as a simple cash transfer. Also, stays connected to larger banks but constantly disconnecting from credit unions. Overall, it's free so can't really complain too much.

I love this app! I can see my spending at a glance. Im happy Mint started sending me weekly summaries. It could work better for debt payments on a credit card. Not all of us use cc's as revolving debt. I usually use 0% interest for a year and Mint nets out my bank and cc payments, so it is hard to fully understand my monthly outflow sometimes. Other than that, the app is great!
replyContent:
Hi Jerry,
Thank you for sharing this feedback with us! Your input is greatly appreciated as it helps us further improve our app. Please feel free to share additional input with our support team on Facebook, Twitter or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC.
-Minh

content: Wonderful - free Best features: Connect all accounts in 1 app. Mortgage doesn't show under debit, so accurate current balance & cedit card debit. Create & track monthly budget (& shows remaining monthly allowance) Track monthly income vs spending (cash flow) Tracks spending from all accounts. If a category isn't correct, it can be changed in 1 click. Chart showing % of spending from each category. Credit score is mostly accurate. Con: Have to log into 1 of my accounts everytime I open the app

The app and service used to be good they stopped short of adding crypto wallet addresses and enough platforms. Others don't work like T-Mobile. It is impossible to upload a CSV or link to Google Sheets. Essentially, they got my data, but not all and it'd not enough to be a full solution for me. Another thing. About the home screen widget, when selecting a line items it used to open the app straight to the account or transaction I pressed. But now Andoid doesn't know which app to open with.
replyContent:
Hi, Mr A! To add your crypto account, see https://intuit.me/3NoPnEN If there is an account you'd like to request Mint to add, please press +Add Accounts, search for the bank you'd like to see and follow the prompts at the bottom. If you need further assistance: https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX To share further feedback: https://intuit.me/3JmLk9W
-Erin

content: Intuit does not invest in this app anymore. Like others, accounts go months without being synced, with no way to verify the credentials. Which makes my net worth tracking inaccurate. I gave up on this app for budget tracking a long time ago, so net worth tracking was all I used it for. Now that's even useless. If they want to focus on their new products, they should just be honest with customers and sunset this app. I'll be finding something better after 10 years of use, ignoring the sunk cost.
replyContent:
Hi Britney, thanks for your review! Please know that your experience is important to us at Mint, and we would be happy to look further into your concerns. To see how often your accounts are updated and how to refresh them http://intuit.me/3WjDKkX Please reach out on Facebook/Twitter or chat so we may better assist you https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX
-Erin

content: I like that this links accounts & automatically updates your spending. But I wish I could have sent an overall budget & filled in from there. Also, I really disliked that it doesn't let you self assign spending. It often mislables certain spending. For ex, I would go to one restaurant and it would label it "Food & Drink", but then the next restaurant would be " Restaurants". Also, my auto credit card payment would be labeled correctly, but if I paid it manually it would be labeled differently.

Mint misses the mark. I love the idea of this app, but it is constantly buggy, some months my income doesn't load in at all so it looks as though I have no net gains and just monthly losses. When you're trying to get an idea of your finances, if it's not actually accurate, it's pointless. The worst part is you have to constantly re-input your banks and credit card information becomes it logs you out every time so even if it's just been 2 days I usually have to re-input my logins. So frustrating.
replyContent:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to submit a review. We would like to help. Please reach out to us here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB

content: Edit #2: Great app, by a team that cares! They read the reviews/care about what you need. Budget, is secure and easy to track.. Edited: below is my frustrated , 2 start rating. Since that rating, I could not find anything better. End result: could use some improvements, but it's the best available... 4 star Done, deleted account. Some nice things, but I am tired of having to change the majority of transactions, getting emails about "excess spending..." When there wasn't...
replyContent: Hey Bill, We absolutely care about you and want to hear what you have to say! It is what helps us get better! I know your time is valuable and I appreciate you taking the time to come back and update your review. Should you need us, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team on Facebook, Twitter, or via chat https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC -Minh

content: App is good, but sometimes too many ads and also kinda slow to update accounts. For some bank links, it doesn't show all accounts. Wish it'd learn a little bit more about my financial patterns; i.e. shouldn't be constantly telling me "large transaction warning" every time a mortgage payment is made. Complaints are relatively minor, which is why only lose 1 star.

I really really wanted to try this app out due to all of the great reviews. Upon installing it, I found that syncing your bank account is not an option, but a requirement. That feels a little intrusive..Its basically the first step when in the setup. I do not feel comfortable linking my bank accounts/refuse to do so and therefore am unable to get any further in the setup to even get to the actual program itself.Maybe a future app where you are not forced to give up your personal account info...?
replyContent:
Hello Justine, Thank you for your feedback. We believe in your right to privacy by all means! Linking your bank account enables Mint to update your finances automatically. We protect your privacy by using the best industry-leading technology. We hope to serve you in the future!

-Eboni

content: 1 star only so hopefully the developers will see this. I've been using mint for over five years, and the one thing I'm shocked they have not added is in the budget category. Budgets when viewing on a computer, shows you everything you've spent money on that's "out of a budget category." On mobile, the budget section will only show spending in the categories you've designated a budget. So on the phone, you could have spent $10,000 in an unbudgeted category, and you'd never know it. Please add!!!
replyContent: Hey Daniel! Thank you for leaving your feedback. We definitely understand where you are coming from. The mobile app is set up to be a simplified, on-the-go experience of our website. There are features currently available on the website that are not available on the phone. We are looking into adding additional features to our app. -BD

content: I've used this app for years. It's great at what it does well. Allowing you to track spending. View your transactions, group them, and view trends. It will track bills and keep track of due dates. Obviously Intuit uses data collected from this app for whatever purposes they want. I'd figure that combined with the previously minimal ads and affiliate links would have been enough to keep the app profitable. But apparently now the ads need to bee a whole screen and be first, before even your cash.

edit: just deleted mint and looking for alternatives. Lately won't update several different bank's accounts, timing out before they're able. I haven't even changed any login information for those banks. Everytime I restart my phone, the settings on mint change so there's no pincode to access the app. So potential security risk there. And the app would be better if it let you switch between budgets for different months, not just see the current one.

This app makes budgeting a nightmare. There is no way to set budgets for varying time frames. Not all of my expenses are monthly, and I do not get paid regularly as a college student either, so I have to go by overall expense tracking to budget(weekly, semesterly, breaks, & annual budgets). There is no way to set budgets for the future, or make weekly budgets(I feel calculating weekly groceries for instance is less accurate on a monthly basis since not all months have the same # of full weeks).

Organizey. I love the detail of accounts, budgeting and bill reminders. I don't like the set up. It was kind of a pain to get all my accounts added. I had added the same chase account added 3 times because I didn't think it went through. I didn't realize what happened so I was stressing for a couple months before I fixed it. Oop. I live by it now though, Its helped me get my finances under control fs fs.

The app is useful during certain major milestones, like figuring out how much rent you can afford, moving in with someone, or if you're considering a loan or bankruptcy. It categorizes purchases through your accounts linked to it. However, it is the most invasive with the worst tradeoff. Finding categorical spending is a chore. Sorting spending by account requires three more clicks than should be necessary. At any given time, 50% of the UI is advertising other Intuit products and loans
replyContent:
Hi Barbara, thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns and want you to be able to track your finances easily with Mint. For easier categorization, you can create a transaction rule: https://intuit.me/3bp8rTP We have also created an "Ads Free" version for our Mint users like you who prefer this option: https://intuit.me/3uSx9D2
-Erin

content: Dropping down to three Stars. Intuit keeps making unnecessary updates to the app. I have used for three years plus now. Why cant we edit pending transaction anymore? Now I have transactions that aren't showing up at all, and Intuit has been reviewing for over a month. Seems like it's almost time to look for another budgeting app. Still meeting some of my needs though.

Overall, it lets me see all my banks in one stop area and not have go into each individual one. But for trying to keep track of Bill's- it only let's you see what is deducted from your account and what your auto pay or already have in place in your bank's bill pay area. You can add additional Bill's but you have to manually input those if it's not bank related.
replyContent:
Hi Ashley,
Your insight as a user is very valuable to us and we want to thank you for taking the time to share this observation with us. Please know that our support team is here for assistance should you have additional concerns or questions. You can reach our support on Facebook, Twitter or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC.
-Minh

content: Pretty useful for tracking your monthly spending. I like that you can be granular with setting the budget. However, It won't let me add notes to "pending" transactions. The auto categorization is not perfect and adding a note on a pending transaction as I review it at the end of the day would be very helpful.
replyContent:
Hi Mike,
We are pleased to hear that you find the app useful for tracking your monthly spending and also love feedback like this as it helps us works towards building an even better experience for our Mint users. Thank you for being part of the Mint family and taking the time to share your experience with us. - JK

content: Useless. Supposed to help track bills, but I added one bank account and four showed up. It said something similar was happening to other Chase bank users and there was a fix. Fix didn't get rid of incorrect accounts. Tried to add my capital one account literally 10 times, it said linked, but never showed up. Tried to add car payment, again, said linked, never showed up. Waited a few days to see if it was just a server issue, nope. Uninstalled.
replyContent: Hello Matt. We appreciate you for leaving your feedback. We understand this is a frustrating experience. There could be many different reasons this issue has happened. Please allow us to investigate your specific circumstances so we can assist you. You can reach us on Facebook, Twitter, or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC -Te'Anna

content: Completely logs me out for no reason, multiple times a day. Then I have to go get my security code, set fingerprint login back up, all for it to log me back out minutes later. I've tried reinstalling, deleting cache, checking settings. Nothing works. Imagine hawking an ad free version when you can't even take the millions you're raking in as a company to make a stable app.
replyContent:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the submit a review. We are sorry to hear about the experience you have had with our app. We would like to further investigate this issue please reach out to our chat support here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB

content: Giving 2 stars for now . When i first got this app couple of years ago i LOVED it. Never missed a payment , everything was organized and overall great. Last few months my accounts don't sync ,I deleted ALL of them and reconnected them. Few won't connect at all , keeps giving me error message and to "try again later" . Its very frustrating and I don't know what to do .

I need to go to a web browser because of how useless this app is for viewing trend or category data. The app is OK for reviewing recent transactions, but if you want to do any *Mint* things like figuring out what you're spending all your money on from month to month, you have to get on a computer and go to a desktop browser. Their mobile browser isn't even optimized for the job. And it's actually gotten worse over time.
replyContent:
Hi John, we appreciate your feedback! To see historical spending and compare that with the current month, you will need to use iOS or the Mint webpage. However, to track the current month's spending, you can select the Monthly tab and tap on the cash flow graph. To see further instructions: https://intuit.me/40sdRCf Thanks for choosing Mint!
-Erin

content: So I had a few issues connecting my account, but I found out it was due to my bank (for security issues)...and when I tried to connect during my bank's business hours, it connected. I've used it for a month and it updates my accounts automatically without issue. Needless to say, I love the app. For those that can't connect accounts or it won't update, I'd say talk to your bank, because the issues come from your bank, not the app. For me, this app works great after the initial hiccups.

I used to really like this app. It tracked my expenses and I could always see what was going in and out. Recently I am going to the web page a whole lot more than using this app as it is getting more and more buggy and less and less useful. Removed: cents from the display, constantly reporting errors updating account, poor updating, duplication of accounts but not values, many more. I'm getting closer and closer to removing the app from my phone.
replyContent: Hi Chris, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. I understand your frustration. We would be more than happy to help you with this issue, can you please reach out to us on Facebook or Twitter so we can give you better assistance -Vanessa

content: Student loan shows same repeated information about 30 times for each one. I have to scroll down a long list of one student loan at a time due to some kind of glitch. Please fix and I'll rate higher. Also, electricity bill no longer updates even though it used to. Login information has been put it several times (yes it's the correct login).

Okay.. this is a neat app, in theory. In execution its a bit of a pain. You get notifications on fees, "tap here to learn more", but it just shows the amount. Why not put the information of where it's from? I've got 5 credit cards, a "interest" fee is a bit vague. While yes, I can do that research myself, this app was supposed to be an "all in one" location for this stuff. Oh, and don't get me started on smaller banks or local credit unions, flagging my account after verification is annoying.
replyContent:
Hi Michelle, thank you for your feedback. It's unfortunate that you're not happy with your Mint experience. We understand your frustration. We can assure you that our customers satisfaction will always be our number one priority. We will certainly look into implementing this change to ensure an amazing experience with every use of the app.

-Eboni

content: Super useful app to show your budgeting and finances of all accounts in one, best to track all incoming and outgoing flow of money so you can avoid any surprise transactions. Reminds you of all credit card payments too to avoid late payment, and keeps you on track with not spending more on categories and notifying you. Best part is you can check how much you have spent at a particular store in a particular duration or whole year. Love this app

The app is fairly easy to use, but it is a shell of what the desktop version is. Here are the three things that are inexplicably and unacceptably missing from the app version. 1) You cant set any goals. The only ones available are "crush credit card debt" and "improve my credit score." 2)You cant recategorize transactions that are pending 3)You can't see categorized but unbudgeted transactions in the budgets tab - no "everything else" section Without these its only good for checking accounts
replyContent:
Hi there, thank you for your feedback. It's unfortunate that you're not happy with your experience using the Mint app. We understand your frustration. We assure you that our customers satisfaction will always be our top priority. We will certainly look into implementing this change to ensure an amazing experience with every use of the app.

-Eboni

content: Despite paying for the ad-free version, am still getting advertising. Most recently for a paid service called Billshark. Very frustrating. The app also seems to have some background process which, even just resting at the default load page, causes the phone to use significant battery. To the point it gets physically warm. Oh, and tired of being accused by representatives of misrepresenting my observations. Would be happy to have a conversation about the matter and how I'm sure it's their app.
replyContent: Hey George, thank you for providing your feedback to us. When it comes to the Billshark ad you are seeing, this is a feature provided by our app. This is not considered part of the Ad-Free experience. We would love to further discuss the issues you are seeing. Please reach out to us on Facebook, Twitter, or chat here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB -BD

content: Went downhill fast. Not sure what is going on but none of the data is correct, the notifications that bills are due do not show in the app anymore. None of my accounts are showing correct balances. All the login info is correct. Clean it up guys. Edit 5/11/21. Newest update wiped out all of my accounts for bills. Bravo, you have effectively made this app 100% useless.
replyContent:
Hi Mareen,
We understand how inconvenient this may be and would like to help. To edit your notification preferences, visit here: https://bit.ly/3einvSb. Most of your accounts should be updated every 8 hours. If they are not updating, we suggest that you contact support on Facebook/Twitter or Customer Care here: https://bit.ly/3uqTZPW.
-Erika

content: I love this App. It has definitely helped me save more money over the past 8 years that I have been using it. I have to give them 4 (would be 4.5) stars simply because they dont have a few of the features from the website in the Android app. I would love to have the goals on the app so I can know where I stand on them without signing into the browser website. Also, the site doesn't store passwords as well as it could. I keep having to input passwords every few months. Other than that, great app.

Summerizes all the information I need to keep track of my bills. Update(2022): don't know what happened, but Mint has become frustrating. It can't keep my accounts straight. Constantly having to re-sync or "fix accounts". Then inactivated and/or mark accounts as duplicates. Getting ready to switch to a competitor. I have been using their products since DOS, even was a Beta tester from QuickBooks. Sad to lose confidence in product.
replyContent:
Hi Aldred, thanks for your feedback. This certainly sounds like a frustrating situation and not what we intend. We'd be happy to look into this further for you so that you can accurately see your money in Mint. To better assist, please reach out to us on Facebook, Twitter, or chat: https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX Thanks for being a long-time Minter!
-Erin

content: Update: Every month I make an automated mortgage payment of the same amount, and every month Mint asks me if I made a large purchase. Why is this payment impossible to recognize? I have a specific budget set that it even matches. Also I still cannot list any cryptocurrency holdings, even manually, that it will keep an accurate track of. Seems easy enough to pull that info once or twice a day.
replyContent:
Hello David, the setting for that notification can be turned off under the "Settings" tab on Mint.com. Certain notifications do not take into account categorization or regular transactions, it's looking at specific amount thresholds. You can use these steps, https://intuit.me/3aY8hTe, to add the manual account.

- Terica

content: I've been loving this app since I downloaded it, until today. I went to check balances etc and I had been logged out, and not by my own doing. When I logged back in, everything had been deleted. Adding the accounts back is fine but the budgets I had set up are all gone. It's obviously not the end of the world but time consuming and annoying.

The deal breaker: You have to wait 3-4 days for your transactions to clear the bank/CU before you see them listed. Unfortunately I think they can't control this. But that delay really sucks when I want to see those transactions fast, and is why I won't be using Mint.
