If that doesn't bother you, this is a very robust app with some pretty amazing budgeting tools. I like that you can link so many different accounts!
replyContent: Hi Phil, thank you for reaching out and leaving your thoughts. We're sad to see that your current experience has suffered, and we appreciate your insights into how we can continue to improve Mint going forward. If you have feedback that you would like to leave directly with Mint you can do so here https://bit.ly/3X0okmL Thanks for using Mint.-Fred

content: Updating my review from 2 stars to 1 since Mint responded and thinks I'm just too dumb to find my bills. I've even re-added them one by one and the only ones showing up in my bills list are all of my student loans. The calendar shows only my student loans. The "upcoming bills" page says they're all paid off even though I have a ton of bills due in a few days on the 1st. My app is broken. I'm finding a different app. Google Pay says they can track bills now, maybe I'll just use them.
replyContent: Hello Summer, We understand your frustration in relation to the new update. I do want to mention that the app is now designed with a summarized snapshot of your accounts that can be expanded to show more detail. We are always appreciative of all feedback our customers give to better improve the next update of the mint app. -MFW

content: It has been 3-4 months of my account data not showing up at all in the mobile app now (web shows them fine) - only transactions show up. Relogging in / reinstalling / clearing cache did nothing. The mobile app is already limited - I'd rate it 3 stars before these issues surfaced due to the significantly limited functionality compared to the web interface. I get that bugs happen, but this has been broken for too long. Sans account balance data, the app is useless for me personally.
replyContent:
Hello George, thanks for taking the time to leave feedback. If you have made sure that the app and your device are up to date and are still having this problem, feel free to reach out to us here for further assistance https://bit.ly/3hTSZjw or on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

- Terica

content: The Mint app works alright, and is there for me to assess my finances whenever I need to. It's easy to use and navigate. I find that I only receive notifications *after* I've opened the app, however. For example, if I don't open the app for a week, it's only once I open it that I'll receive notifications for the past week, like payday, over budget, bills due, etc. So the notification functionality isn't really there for me. Others may find this more of a tradeoff than I do.

This app used to be good. Now, it's horribly bloated and it takes forever to scroll to your budgets. The app budgets show different category totals than the web version, and you also can't change the category of pending transactions despite being able to do so on the desktop. Will not be using this app anymore and will strictly be using the website now. Disappointing.
replyContent:
Hi Zack,
We understand the inconvenience this has caused you. The website does offer a little more insight than the app. Please know that we are doing what we can to further improve our app. We always appreciate customers who take the time to give us their feedback, your experience with our products means everything to us.

-Priscilla

content: Don't rely on this app! Intuit purchased and rebranded this to work with their budgeting software and de-emphasized the bill tracking functionality. It used to be a good way to keep track of bills. However Mint constantly logs you out, and gives no push notification when accounts don't update even when it is logged in. Check it at least once a week, which diminishes the convenience of having bill tracking.
replyContent:
Hi Matt,
Every user's experience is unique and we always want to ensure our users have the best experience. We are sad to hear that you are encountering these issues. Please allow us the opportunity to take a closer look at your situation. Please reach out to our support team on Facebook, Twitter or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC.
-Minh

content: Great for the most part. I have been using Mint since like 2012 and it was a game changer for personal finance folks out there. I know NOW there are many others, but back in the day not so much - also FREE and backed by intuit. I mean you really cant beat it. It has since then became a bit harder to sync things. Certain insitution they have even given up, which tells me that they are cutting back on the maintenance... I still use the app A LOT, but I also supplement with another tracker.

I'd give it 5stars normally, but something has happened in the past 4 days and idk wtff is going on with it. When I open the app, the overview shows my account balances, but when I click on them all transactions are gone. If I click the Monthly tab, nothing is there at all. Web version is fine. But the app is all messed up, I've even logged out and back in, uninstalled then reinstalled, and nothing works.
replyContent: Hi Chelsea, we are disheartened to hear that you have issues using Mint. We would love to assist you. Check these links for info on account updates http://intuit.me/3WjDKkX and missing transactions http://intuit.me/3WaMyt7. If you still need help, reach out to our Facebook/Twitter pages or Mint Support website here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB - Fred

content: Not very useful when you want something to keep up with finances if your credit union doesn't do online syncing. Tried to add checking and savings accounts under "Property" like Mint instructed, but couldn't add transactions. Thought paying the .99 per month might make it open options to do that, but no, it did not. I've deleted all my info and am canceling my account as soon as I figure out where to find that option.
replyContent:
Hey, it's disappointing to hear that you experienced issues using Mint. We would love to assist you with your current issue. Please reach out to our Facebook/Twitter pages or chat team: http://intuit.me/3GoSSZC for assistance. We look forward to hearing from you!
- Harry

content: Very good app. It allows me to see my finances at a glance and gives me the information I need to decide what I'm doing right and what I'm doing wrong. A minor comparing might be I don't like how the categories work. For example, my internet payments are bundled with my online shopping. I'd prefer them to be separate. My groceries are bundled with my dining out and fast food. I'd prefer them to be separate. Otherwise a very good app.
replyContent: Hi Jon, Thank you for taking the time to give us this valuable feedback. While you cannot change the main categories, you can add sub-categories. Follow these steps to learn how:https://bit.ly/321cPzE. If you want to customize more than just a category, you can add tags and organize your transactions as you choose. -Debra

content: Wont let me connect any of my bank accounts or credit cards. Wont allow me to connect to any of my accounts. I bank with a large bank and all my credit cards are with big lenders so not sure what the issue is, but considering I cant connect to my accounts this thing is completely useless. I thought if it was made by the same company as quickbooks it would be reliable and trustworthy but it is certainly not reliable of useful if I cant even get started. Wish I could give 0 stars. Complete waste of time.

Works amazing. I use it all the time to keep an eye on things. I can also check things on here that I can't check on banking site. Can't add a pc account which I don't like but at least I can keep an eye on other accounts. Update not liking it now since only 2 accounts are updating. Nothing else is and it's been very frustrating. I may have to delete
replyContent: Hey Nicole! We're disheartened to see that your enjoyment and usage of our Mint app has diminished due to these connection issues. Follow the steps here to refresh the account: http://intuit.me/3XRrskY If you see an error, or are unsuccessful, reach out to our Mint Chat support via the app, or this link! http://intuit.me/3wjGsMN -Amber

content: Love Mint. I check it almost every day just to remember what transactions I've carried out because I sometimes I forget. You can see your transactions daily, check your overall score, set a budget, set a goal. Has def helped me in my monthly finances. I used to write everything down and now I don't have to and I can check it wherever I go. Recommends great credit cards too. Just love love. Down side is that it takes a few days to get real time credit score but overall you get a good idea.

I really only use it to keep track of transactions and how much money I have. Trying to categorize everything is time consuming. My bank accounts keeps having trouble connecting, but I think that's on my bank's end. Update: Latest update really messed up how well this app worked. Its confusing now. Has more ads. No thanks.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We have rolled back the recent interface changes. Thanks for your patience while we work on this.

content: Overall very solid and easy to use with good view of my whole financial picture. Wish rules for auto categorization could be customized with search terms. For example, most home depot transaction descriptions include the store number or other variations of home depot information. but I want a single home depot category, so I have to make a new rule for each group of home depot transactions. Same is true for Amazon, sbux, etc.
replyContent: We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your important feedback.

content: Very good. There were only a couple of accounts I couldn't link. It's great to have an overall picture of my finances. I like being able to tag expenditures and income for my self employment. 1/26/21 in response to developer comments. Thanks for the tip. The main problematic account is US Bank Reliacard issued for unemployment benefits. I could find US Bank easily enough, but several attempts to link that account failed, so I gave up. Several months have passed and I haven't revisited the issue.
replyContent: Hi Linda, Thank you for this nice review. We are bummed that a couple of your accounts aren't linking to Mint. It is always our goal to expand our reach to different financial institutions. Please go to the article here for guidance on the next steps to request for your institutions to be added to our list:https://bit.ly/2BTGbHs. -DS

content: I'm looking for an app that lets me create subcategories under existing categories. I made a new category and it has disappeared. I also want to be able to connect a debit from my synced bank account to a bill or payment that is due. If I make a payment early I am not able to connect that payment to the item it is paying. I also cannot enter a credit card balance without it being due all at once. This is not an easy app, it is not customizable, and it says payments are overdue when paid early.

The app is kind of useless. It's fine for seeing your expenses at a glance, but anything past that and you need to be on a computer. You can't batch change expenses, credit card accounts are constantly unlinking, and pop-ups will suddenly close mid-edit. It makes me resent Mint that I cannot do some of the most basic tasks in the app and must be tied to computer - the whole point of Mint is to make my financial life easier, no?
replyContent: We truly appreciate you taking the time to provide your feedback.  We have noted this and will provide it to the product team for further review.

content: I have been using this aplication for a really long time. Unfortunately it got worse. Account update takes a really long time. Much longer than it used to be. Such a waste of battery when you open the it and wait for the accounts to update or sync up. When it was free for some and paid for other it used to update faster for paid users (before they were acquired). Advertising on the application is out of control. I'm looking for a substitute. Definitely deleting my account and the application.

I like being able to see all of my accounts and cards in one place. I don't love that it shows the current statement balance on the cash flow instead of available funds. Example I had $2k deposited into one savings account and transferred it to the correct one a few days later. The statement for the month posted when $2k was in the wrong account and it stayed there on Mint for the whole month even though it had transferred and posted to the correct account. Annoying but mint is still useful

Mint is a pretty good app. I might recommend it depending on someone's needs. It does a great job of breaking down previous transactions into various categories. For a free app it does great. It needs a little fine tuning for catching smaller transactions. For instance it categorized my food from Fas Mart as "shopping". I do wish I could sort/filter based on sub categories like fast food vs groceries under the food section. 3 stars for requiring online connection and the niggling tweaks.

Overall, the app is helpful, but I was hoping for a little more. It would be nice to be able to expand the budgeting features to have more custom options rather than simply the most common categories. You can also only set one goal for each of your accounts, but I'd like to do multiple. Because, who's only ever saving for one single thing?
replyContent: Hey Jenna! Thanks for your review. We're glad to see that you're enjoying your money management experience with Mint & we appreciate your kind feedback on how we can continue to grow Mint! One goal per account is our current feature, and you can see more about that here: https://intuit.me/3Dh06MJ We're thankful for Minters like you! -Amber

content: Awesome money app!! Has everything you need to take control of your money! I highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend!!! Save time and sync up all your accounts in one location to track ALL your spending, no need to manually add transactions. Set budgets, add bills, categorize transactions, review trends, check your credit score report and more! ... For. FREE!!! Amazing! If you're serious about your money, install this app!

I love this app. great overview of my finances and transactions. One of my accounts can have trouble re-syncing, but if I add it as if it weren't already added, it works without creating a new account, just updates the old so not a huge deal. Overall, just wish it had more features but I don't even know what they would be, it's really great already!

I love the app since it gives me an snapshot of my current financial situation. I have been using it for more than 5 yrs and dont see that changing any time soon. The only reason it not 5 star is because sometimes the accounts dont refresh together and take forever and also it doesn't seem to remember the categories for certain stores. I always just go back through all my transactions and fix them so my budget is more accurate. But overall I am very pleased.

I like the simple design and how it creates rules for you automatically. Plus you can add your own subcategories. One thing I think is lacking is not being able to put down to the cent when adding in an amount for a category. My husband is in finance and I wanted to switch to Mint because we've been working our budget on a spreadsheet, down to the cent every month for the last 9 years, so it's been hard to round for me because I know that "money" is "missing".üòÇ
replyContent:
Hi Sabra, we appreciate your feedback! When reviewing your spending on the Overview screen, it will show you whole amounts only, without the cents. However, if you click the transaction category you would like to see, you will be able to view the exact balance and exact transactions associated as well. Thanks for being such an awesome Minter!
-Erin

content: Overall a very good app. Links and updates automatically with all your accounts, you are able to call or email and receive a prompt response, etc. I've used it for several years and haven't found a better app yet. Only issue I seem to have is linking my personal account each time. Its kind of a pain, but I don't think everyone has this issue.

Mint was recommended to me by my brother who is a financial consultant for a well-known company, and I found I really like it. But I wish the app had as much usability as the desk top version. I don't have access to all the features on the app, like Goals. Still, that's a small price to pay for having all my income and purchases listed out, along with my budgets.

Updating from 3 to 4 stars as I was able to link the account by working with a customer rep. That said, the app still is not very user friendly / intuitive. They could do a much better job with the GUI. ............... Can't link one of my accounts. Also, sometimes accounts do not refresh automatically. The analysis of finances is good.
replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback.  Would you be willing to contact us so we can work with you to get your account linked in Mint?  You can contact us by Chat using the following link: https://help.mint.com/888962161

content: App is useful if you can figure out how to edit and remove things when needbe, however it is way over complicated and totally confusing. I would normally give 3 stars given that it is useful, however because my phone number changed, I can't get into my account. In order to "recover" my account they want a pic of an id, etc. Offer a damn password reset. Absolutely stupid.
replyContent:
Hi, Nathan! If you are unable to sign into your Mint account, you can choose to sign in a different way and get a code sent to your email: https://intuit.me/3ZWm4xu To make changes to the transaction date, name, and category: https://intuit.me/413JnXF We would be happy to further assist you on Facebook/Twitter or chat: https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX
-Erin

content: I have been using this app for a week and so far I love the financial organization! I can split a transaction, (one of my favorite features)! Sometimes I buy groceries and personal items in one purchase and I can easily split them into different categories. This helps my budget! With that said, I would find it helpful if I could edit the categories. The categories are overwhelming and it would be beneficial if we could edit.

Worked ok for the first day. Now, the app refuses to load my bank account. It hasn't refreshed in 4 days even though it claims to refresh and download data when I open or drag down. Without accurate bank data, the rest of the app is inaccurate and obsolete. I've gone back into the app many times the last several days as I just got paid and paid my bills. P.s. I tried relinking my bank, and that didn't work. I've also gone to my banks app and to their website, and it works fine.
replyContent: Hey there, thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We are saddened to hear about your experience with our app. Most of our accounts update automatically when you sign in. Have you tried uninstalling and reinstalling? If your issue persists please reach out to us on Facebook, Twitter, or via chat: https://intuit.me/3Apniad -Jae

content: I've been using Mint for awhile now, and really liked the app at first. However lately it has been frustrating to work with. Many of my accounts constantly reconnect. I'm unable to add certain budget categories, and the income portion refuses to reflect anything other than paychecks (like your stimulus check...) On the app you can't reclassify a transaction's category until it is no longer pending, but you can on the website. Bringing the app to par with the site would go a long way!
replyContent:
Hi Michael,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. Please know that we are constantly working to further improve the app with the feedback given to us by our users. Please do not hesitate to share any additional insights you may have with our support team on Facebook, Twitter, or via chat at  https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC. 
-Minh

content: This app used to be my primary way to see my financial "big picture," but it has slowly become more broken over the years following the acquisition by Intuit - with accounts taking too long to refresh (and showing $0 while doing it), and other accounts needing to be verified too often. It is a free service from a company that makes an enormous amount of money on financial software, after all, so it's not surprising they would want to move people over to something else less cumbersome.
replyContent: Thank you for provide us with your feedback.

content: Find I don't use this at all in the last year as I switched to TD and they have their own built in program that does the same thing so it's less of a hassle trying to get my accounts to connect when they disconnect honestly. Also the numbers were always off when I used to use this program but since doing it with other programs I've had no issues with numbers not adding up.
replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback.

content: Maybe, this is a bug in their system but initially it set up on my phone without the correct phone number, never verified any contact info. Despite having the correct email, the verification code received in my email never allowed access to my account and it would ask for a code from my phone or a password that was never set up. All other apps have an easier set up process for creating an account. Initially disappointed with this process. Now waiting for an agent to respond in chat. üòí
replyContent: We are sorry for the issue you have encountered. Solutions to many common issues can be found here: https://mint.intuit.com/support . If you still need assistance you can reach out to our chat support here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB

content: Had login issues when connecting to my bank. Kept telling me the login data was wrong. Re logged into my bank several times, each time just to be sure. I am going to assume its the pick-a-hard -as-hell tile match system (which is made more difficult on a phone) since its incorporated into the login process. Couple that with the other reviews on software issues has made me rethink this app. Did this at home from my PC and had no problems. The interface is nice. Skip the mobile if your having problems.

I've used & (mostly) loved this app for years, otherwise it would have 1 star right now. It says all my accounts are updated. But they are not. That is SO much worse than refusing to update the accounts. I was under the impression my accounts were up to date because they say they are. However when I actually logged into my bank account & 4 different credit card accounts, the accounts were NOT actually up to date. How can I trust the app again? That is a total failure!
replyContent:
Hi Cheryl, thank you for your feedback. We are saddened to hear that you are experiencing trouble with your Mint account not updating successfully. To see information about account updates: https://intuit.me/3LM5KZi For further assistance, contact us on Facebook, Twitter, or chat: https://bit.ly/3t3oUmX Thanks for being a long-time Minter!
-Erin

content: Great app for tracking your spending and coming up with a monthly budget. The app links to all your accounts and gives you a quick and accurate snapshot of your money. It recognizes your purchases and automatically categorizes them, while allowing you to change the category if needed, say from "groceries" to "house supplies". You are able to create a spending limit on any and all categories and the app adds up all your limits so you can see your total monthly spending limit. This app is amazing!

Pros: Great way to organize your finances. You make your own spending categories and it automatically categorizes your transactions. You can make goals and it'll tell you how much you need to save per month and when you accomplished it. You can add many accounts for it to track. Cons: Sometimes It takes awhile to load up-to-date info about your banking but it's not a big problem. It ALWAYS duplicates purchases. Always. You have to manually select those purchases and mark them as duplicates

It's a very functional app, however, the account creation is garbage. I accidentally created three accounts because it automatically creates an account with whatever email and password you use. It doesn't verify if there was already an account. I currently have 3 accounts, I asked them to consolidate and delete the others but they were unable to do so. If it weren't for this cheap way of getting you into their system it'd be 5 stars.
replyContent:
Hi there. We are bummed out too that you are having this experience! Multiple accounts can understandably get confusing. You can certainly delete the duplicates. Please see: https://intuit.me/3D4ytaA If you need help setting up your account, we'd be happy to assist. We can be reached on Facebook, Twitter or via chat here: https://bit.ly/2NrRCZC

HB

content: I love this app. Connecting my banks and credit card was easy and it is easier to manage my budget since it automatically updates with all of my charges. Sometimes the algorithm that says which category things should go in are a little off but never enough to cause major issues. I recommend this app to anyone who struggles to manage not to buy everything they see online. It makes a no spend that much easier.

I track my accounts quite closely and Mint makes my life so much easier. Instead of having to open several apps (credit card, bank, other credit card, etc) I can just open Mint and get my account info in one place. As if that's not good enough, they also include analytics on the data so you can see how much you're spending in various categories. It's a very helpful service and app. I've been using Mint for a long time and it's essential for creating a realistic monthly budget.

Great app for tracking where your money is going. Kinda bites when the accounts suddenly need to be verified again and the mobile version doesn't have all the functionality of the web, but it is what it is. It'd be really cool if you could set how frequent your accounts update. I don't need my IRA/401k to update every time I log in.

Great App easy to use. I give a 3 star rating for 1 reason. The budgeting tool only allows a calendar month rather than being able to customize a time frame that is equivalent to 1 month. For example, income is paid monthly on the 15th of every month. Therefore a budgeted month from say Aug 15th through Sep 15th would be much more favorable. This doesn't feel like a complicated fix. If that were available, I would give 4 or 5 stars.
replyContent: Hey there Trevor, thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We sincerely appreciate your feedback, as we are always searching for ways to improve our customer's experience. We will be sure to pass this information along to our developers. Thank you for being a part of the Mint family! - Kayla

content: It's not for budgeting. It basically connects bank and credit cards of yours ( a long and tedious process) to the app and then categorizes your purchases. It has no other "smart" or actionable data for budgeting and the budgeting tool just tells you where you've overspent and to anyone who has trouble budgeting, I think we know what we spend the most money on; what we need to know is how much we can reduce in a given area we are overspending in, or where we have real opportunities to save money.
replyContent: Hello Benjamin. We are very grateful for your insights. I wanted to let you know about the Mint website which allows for a different visual look as well as more in-depth tools to reach your financial goals. If you have any further feedback on how we can improve the Mint app, please reach out to our support team on Facebook or Twitter. -Amanda

content: Mint is awesome, overall. I use it daily. The only reason it's not five stars is because it occasionally miscategorizes transactions as random businesses, but the amounts are always correct. For pulling from multiple sources of accounts, it's a critical tool for getting a pulse on personal finance. Intuit is a great company. Plus it's free! I've never had any major issues. Thanks for the great app!

This is very useful to keep track of all of my finances (although sometimes I have to re-add an account). I don't know what they did or if it's my new phone, but I don't have the quick view of all my account totals like I did before which kind of sucks, but I guess that's more secure (although I should be able to determine how to secure that myself).
replyContent: Hey Christopher, we appreciate you taking the time to leave your feedback with us. We love that you find Mint helpful for tracking your finances. We do understand where you are coming from and would be happy to forward your feedback to our development team for further consideration. Thank you for being an awesome Minter! -Brycen

content: This app is only OK for budgeting. It is disappointing that a company like Intuit doesn't have a better app. Categories have to be their categories. You can customize subcategories. But some basic modern app technology is missing, like placing a curser in a new box to enter data and printing reports. I think they 'slapped' this together to cross-sell other financial services like insurance and checking accounts. Keep looking for something better.
replyContent: Thank you for providing your feedback to us. If you have any further or suggestions please reach out to our support team here: https://intuit.me/3QChxwB

content: Mint is super helpful! I've been using Mint for at least 5 years, and they've come along way to make things more user friendly! This is the only free finance dashboard that I'm aware of and that I trust using. You can see all of your finance info in one place - bank accounts, credit cards, loans, etc. Having everything in one place makes budgeting and debt pay down so easy. I highly recommend!!

Turns out that this is trash. Almost everything is wrong except for some bank info, which I could just track from my banking website. What I'm most disappointed in is the subscription tracking. It's not just incomplete, it also seems to just make stuff up. It says I have subs to Help and Unimart, which I've never even heard of. ZERO information is given about them and you cannot interact with or edit anything it puts in the subscription list. You're about better off with an excel spreadsheet.
replyContent: Hi Michael, thank you for leaving us a review! We are sincerely disheartened to hear about your experience and the difficulties you are encountering while tracking your subscriptions. We would love to take a closer looker into this with your, and offer our assistance. Please contact us on Facebook or Twitter, and we'd be happy to help! - Kayla

content: The dashboard and tools are great but it is unable to connect 2 accounts, including my mortgage. -Erika

content: this app is useless. It says that I spend $300 (for example) in May so far, thats $300 more than the same time last month. Indicating I spent no money the previous month. Those are just 2 examples. Bottom line is that it's presenting false information. I deleted the app and I now use the mobile version of the website, which is great.

content: After almost two months, I'm hooked. I can't believe I haven't found this app till now, really helping me get over my hare-brained organization skills. I simply love the care they put into the navigation in the app. It literally takes one second to make a note, where other apps require several clicks just to start typing it in! Also, if you need app that works on your phone, desktop, browser, watch, ... and is a joy to use in all of the cases, this is your new friend.

content: It's NOT FREE. They lock you in but allow only 5 active projects. Otherwise, it's an exceptional piece of software. replyContent: Hello, the reason for which new categories cannot be added is that Wallet uses machine learning that works with structured data. However, you can rename the main categories or add your own subcategory please see here: https://bit.ly/3IGl8sc. We also recommend using labels, which are helpful in working with transactions. So happy to have discovered this app! M surprised at how much i spend.. Small money means alot
Very straightforward, easy to use. super recommended! üòä
Great app...all my expenses track and organise category wise...!!!
Very good application for the daily expenses..
Very simple and easy to use. Does the job it's meant to do.
Best app to manage the income and expenses
very simple and so easy to use , 6 stars!
I have only used it for a short while but it is amazing, as it allows you to categorize your spendings and mention the specific details about your spendings. You can even save your progress.
User interface is awesome and easy to use super app for financial management

Great app. Easy to use UI. Can track my expenses easily. I also use it to track how much I have invested in different places. However currently there is no way to add the current value of the investment. It would be easy if you add the feature to mark an account as investment account and the. have and additional field for it where I can update the current value and keep rough track of how investment is growing

Love this app. I use it everyday to track my expenses. Pros: + No Ads, No Bloatware + Very Easy and Intuitive + Can backup and move data between devices using a backup file. Cons: - No cloud storage: Would be useful to link data to a gmail account and use between multiple devices - Credit Card Cycles: Card cycles are never the same as the month cycle. Even though these are just improvements that can be added in the future, the app is pretty great as it is.

I have been using this app for a few months. Till now the experience is quite decent. I could track almost all the expenses. Just one thing I would ask as a modification is credit card expense tracking. Since most the credit card expense start from months and at that time you have just paid the last month bill. So, tracking of credit card seems tricky.

Good app. Simple and basic for daily expenses tracking but I have one issue that it clubs all accounts together I want to see my bank balance separate and my credit card spending different it clubs everything together in the monthly above which is kind of confusing for me. Also the account balance doesn't seem to be correctly updated. Please look into it. Overall all good app

Simple and efficient app. Would buy the pro version if you add certain features like 1. Duplicate expense so i don't have to type things which repeats on daily/weekly basis, 2. Multi device support like WhatsApp Web so i can add things and see my expenditure on computer as well, 3. Add a photo to an expense so i can store my bill photo with that expenditure, 4. Swipe left or right to switch between months

I will give you 4 stars if you add sub-categories and the ability to sync among multiple devices. I will give you 5 stars if you provide the option to sync with my demat account and bank account, the option for UPI payments within the app, the option for sharing the data with others in real-time and the crypto wallet. In fact, I would pay you $100. Good luck :)

"I'm loving this money app! It's super easy to use and helps me track my expenses and savings like a pro. The app's features are really helpful for managing my finances on the go. I've been able to stay on top of my budget and even save a bit extra. Highly recommend for anyone looking to get their finances in check! üëç"

Seems easy to use and the free version have enough feature. My only complain is that it's local and can't be accessed via a website or desktop app so I can't input with my PC/Laptop and there's no Investment category, there's Account though which is helpful. Other than that this App is perfect. I'll try it for a month before deciding to buy the PRO.

Basically the perfect money tracking app. Only giving 4 stars because I have one feature missing I would like: Have the categories be dividable into sub-categories. I have separate categories for food, clothing, medicine, etc. All of these fall within the essentials, but that has to be a separate category. The budgeting has the "Essentials" category, but the listed expenses are the sub categories. Really inconvenient to keep putting them in a calculator and manually compute.

Pretty good app. Covers almost all the bases I have a need for while keeping it simple. The budget and analysis features are nice. One think lacking I would say is the lack of default account. Like mostly I am spending from one account, so I want it to be selected unless I change it. This makes it kind of repetitive to have to select the same account again and again.

Amazing app. Exactly what I was looking for. Simple features. Not overly complicated, but packed with all the essentials to keep track of all the expenses, incomes, investments and losses. Just two suggestions - 1. Can you provide an assurance on how our sensitive data is stored and not misused. 2. Can you add an option to create categories for transfer between accounts. In that way we can track our savings/investment we are doing by transferring money to a demat account, for example.

I give 4 star, really a good app. But It would have been good if there was a sub-category option within the category, as there are many items in grocery, so to categorize them, it becomes necessary to have sub-categories. Take another example, if I want to invest, then either I will have to create different categories for investing in different places and my total investment value will also not be visible together. If it will fix, I'll give 5 star.

This is so easy to calculate everything and see your expenses end of the month. I am a big foodie and I spent lot of money on food more of ordering food but with this app now I have a graph which shows how much I have spent on food and that kinds of hold me back to order less from outside. How much spent on transportation, my different bills, ration literally I have graph of everything.

This app is the best money tracking app I have used. But I believe nothing is perfect. So I have found one small thing you guys could add. I get a proper expense tracking for a month. But why not add that for each day? Just a sum of spendings for that day displayed beside the date in the page where all the records are shown. That is the only grime I have. Awesome app design guysüòéüëå

I've tried countless expense management apps, even built my own in Python, but this one amazed me. No ads, incredibly useful features, and a fantastic free version. I wish I could support the developer by getting the pro version, but as a student, I can't afford it. Still, I truly appreciate this app and the effort behind it. Coming from someone who has tested almost every expense manager on the Play Store, this is by far the best. Hats off to the developer!

I'm very new to budgeting money & I'm so glad I found this app! It's so detailed in a variety of differnt ways/visuals which is exactly what I need. Thank you so much to the creators of this app! You've done a phenomenal job! I also really appreciate the fact that you can choose the free version (for when you are first getting used to the app) but then there is an optional upgraded version with more features if you please. I'm loving this! It actually makes budgeting fun & not so intimidating üôÇ

It's easy to use and is quite useful to keep records of the expenses. One change I'd recommend is to connect the categories of 'income' & 'expense'; like there could be a single source that gives you money as well as takes money from you (a person or a business). So it'll be easier to calculate the total outstanding and also when you refer the charts.

The app is great! It has certain default categories, you can customise more as per your needs. It's a nice tracking app. All the recorded data is also presented visually, so you get an overview or bifurcation of your expenses. It would have been better if they had more default categories and icons in the free accessibility of the app. All in all, a good experience!

It's a very basic, simple money manager app. No need to enter mobile number or email ID. Since it's a simple app, I can customise they way I want. So I deleted all the preloaded categories and created my own categories.  I also liked that besides income and expenses, there is a transfer tab too. Useful, because there are cases where you get money or spend. Like when we move money to a bank deposit account.

First budgeting app I've been able to use for more than a few hours without hating it. Love being able to track everything in one place. I don't know how to connect between devices yet, also I'm not able to put a due date on budget items, but I'm ok with those being my only complaints. Everything else is fantastic, being able to create my own accounts, categories, make notes, and especially transfer between accounts so I can keep track of savings and my sinking funds more easily has been great.

When i download this app, i can't believe that I'm not spending too much money anymore. I spend it wisely. This app change the way I'm spending my money. It even motivated me more to not spend a thing! Feeling like I'll be rich when the statistics and data reached at the end of the month lol. It even can have an actual data to download on this app! Hope that there's a combined income and expense statistics that red and green are all into one analysis so it'll be much simple. Overall, it's good!

I have been using this for a month now. I don't see how any other app will get as good as this does. It gets all the basics just right. No ads, none of your financial data goes off your local storage, the UI is very intuitive, the color scheme is perfect, And if you want to do some advanced analytics, you can always export the data as a CSV file and load it into Excel. (haven't tried that yet) Plus the pro version isn't a stupid subscription. It's an inexpensive one time purchase.

This has been a super awesome app to use. I recently purchased pro version from my other account and have been satisfied with the use. Kudos to Ananta!! I also had a suggestion for improvement: There can be an option to add some labels to an expense. For example, if someone is going on a trip, they can just add the appropriate labels to the expense, which can then be super easy to keep track of.

Great app to keep track of my expense . The categorizes and the user experience is very easy to manage and understand, it makes my money in track without confusion. Also the budget section is really really great . It helps me to be vigilant of my expenses and keeps me reminded. 1 problem is there , how to add the amount in income section??? That's something that I am not able to access to and I need it

I usually don't leave reviews but I had to since I found this app after going through 50 other similar ones. No ads, easy to use and it's pretty well rounded. One small suggestion is to have the note show instead of the type of expense. Or you could have the note as the main header and the type of expense icon on the side. But amazing app, would recommend if you're looking to be financially responsible like me!

Great, easy to use app. Love that everything is manual instead of linking to card accounts. I do wish there was a way you could indicate you've been paid back for something and then have that money be added back to the budget for that category. Then I don't feel like I went over my dining out budget even when someone pays me back for a meal!

Everything is good, just that it's a bit hard to track recurring payments like EMIs' or house expenses. Would be nice if I could track recurring payments with drop-down values to choose from like bi-weekly, monthly etc. and if it's made available in free version itself that would be perfect. Would be interested to see such a feature in next update.

I've been looking for a way to track expenses and i think this is it. I absolutely love the app and interface. I only have one issue, and that is i can't sync the app data from cloud. Developers if you're reading this review please add an option to connect your local app data to cloud. It would help a lot. I know it may arise some security issue but those issues can be solved with encryption. I would love to continue using your app.

Good app But can I request a feature? It will be great if we can view history of balances of each day. Problem is sometimes I forgot to add entries and then after few days I add but might miss few entries. Currently no way to point which items I missed to add. It will be great if we can have history balances for each account and I can compare it against my bank statement

I've been using this app for the past 2 months and I love the experience. It's super minimal and exactly what I need. One suggestion would be add a piechart for each account under accounts as well. Currently you show a piechart only for total expenses of the month. When you click on the individual account like card or cash it shows only what are the expenses were but not the distribution of the expenses in that account.

Hi! I just downloaded the app and found out that there are sections for Income, Expenses and Transfer, but there is no section for tracking investments. When are you coming up with that? Because that section is very important (with sub-categories) of investment such as Stocks, PPF, Mutual Funds/SIPs, etc. And would love it if it would automatically add the last month's entry for SIP deduction. Another disappointment is when I added an entry in Transfer, it didn't deduct my main account balance.

Anant, Definitely one of the best application I used, loved the Account option, which is missing in the most of the other apps. There are few things which needs to be updated, but as of now I will suggest you one thing, Bring down the "Save" button to the bottom, just as per user flow and I don't think "Cancel" button is required, since the back button does the same Job.
replyContent: Dear User, Thank you for your suggestion. If you have further questions or issues, do not hesitate to write at contact.ananta.raha@gmail.com

content: The app looks great. Although I do have a feature request. Pls allow to add multiple categories to same record. If I am spending for petrol for my vehicle and I also spend for insurance for the same vehicle,it would be great to see how much I spent in each category. Each category has overlapping records. This would be a nice feature to add.

It is a good application for tracking all your expenses and incomes from various sources. I have been using this app for the past 2.5 years. It has a smooth and simple UI. However, I would like the following improvements: 1) The addition of sub-category options, which would make it easier to track details without creating multiple categories for similar sub expenses. 2) An option to set a money-saving goal for specific purchases.

Lovely app. However would recommend few things.. 1. Kindly help with the description display of the income or expense on the account page itself so we are aware of what the income or expense was all about. 2. It would be great if the app could directly record the income and expenses by syncing the details through our message section so that there is no discrepancy as we have to currently feed the data in to the qpp and the accounts don't tally at times. Love the app otherwise! Great work!

It's so convenient to use. Everything that I wanted in one place. Edited: Have been using this app since more than 3 years. But the sad part is I am not able to back up. Backups are in mbak format which is not opening in any of my devices. Kindly suggest so that I can get my backups in pdf or excel. It would be a great help for me. Thank you.

Love this app! It makes it super easy to budget, and there aren't way too many bells and whistles like other apps. The only thing I would like to see on a future update is the note we add to a transaction listed on it on the homepage so we can see what we bought at a glance.

A very well-rounded app that helps to both expense track, and budget, across accounts and categories - it has a full set of features, nothing omitted. I'm editing to add that a great feature is the keypad for entering numbers is also a calculator. This means I can quickly divide an entry into, for eg, groceries and airtime. Such a useful app, I highly recommend it.

(Free Version) Not fancy, but very functional. I like that you can so easily track not only how much you're spending but also from which money source. Another favorite feature is the calculator function that you can seemlessly use WHILE adding your expense. I wish that it had an option to change the "month" start date, and that the list of expenses showed what or where you purchased instead of the budget category name (especially since the category icon already gives you this info).

I love the fact that I can add multiple bank accounts. You can add and subtract money and input exact amounts and it calculates the addition or deduction for you. You can add a note to describe the monetary amount, whether for a bill or salary deposit etc.. Very neat app. I like that it's more personal and you can input the information.

Ability to create accounts in different currencies is missing. Being stuck with one currency and unable to create new accounts in different currencies is disappointing. Another thing that is missing is Including/Excluding accounts to/from total balance and as many have mentioned, automatic synchronization (with Google Drive NOT being THE ONLY option). I would've given 4,6 stars but...

Very simple and useful ad-free app to track expenses and budget funds. Multiple accounts can be set up and you can reflect income as well as funds transfers between accounts. I'm finding this much more useful than just a budget app since I can track my actual expenses to ensure I don't over spend. it would be great to be able to enter recurring transactions but that may result in less attention giving to the balance tracking

Like others have said, there is no recurring transaction option. What really bugs me, tho, is that if you make a credit card payment from your bank account, the payment is ADDED to your credit card balance (thus increasing it) rather than deducting the payment. If I pay $200 toward a $1000 credit card bill, the balance should decrease to $800, not increase to $1200. In order to correct the balance, it has to be manually changed.

I'm grateful to this app for helping me manage "my money" efficiently. I am already content with the app, BUT I would support it with paying for the premium version, IF you'd add a feature to take pictures of receipts! I don't like if I have a lengthy list to list them all, I WOULD spend MONEY even if I have to save on the side for a few days. this rules, please add the suggestion ü´∂ love lots üíñ

Really like the concept of the app and the layout. It's very easy to use. It would be better if you could set the budget period rather than it being monthly so I can monitor paycheck to paycheck. It would also be better if money transferred into savings was deducted from remaining amount.

Excellent app. Very good and I can't remember seeing ads. It captures savings, expenses, account balances, etc. Only 2 things that i would like to see are: 1. projections based on my monthly expenses and savings. 2. Being able to see expenses within any period whether it is 3 days in a month or week, etc.

Very helpful. Easy to use. No ads which is a plus plus points. It helps me manage my money (cash, gcash, bank money), I also use it to track those who owed me money (debit/credit). I kept on thinking that I have missing money before, it's just that I forgot where I used the money HAHA, now I can track my expenses as well with the help of this app. Great app, super loved it.

A very nice app, but it lacks a few features I miss. - there's no way to add pending transactions and due dates - add custom fields to records. Eg. mark a contact as the recipient of a loan - attach media other than textual comment to records. Eg. photo of a cheque or voice notes - categories should be arranged in two levels (main/sub-cathegory). Eg. bills/electricity, bills/cellular, &c. - amounts are hard to read and enter due to lack of thousands separation and 00[0] buttons

Decided today to purchase the paid app after using the free version for a month. Setting up and editing accounts and categories is very easy. I haven't tried the budgeting feature yet and it looks just as easy to manage as the rest of the app. Like I've seen others say, I also appreciate the hands on manual nature of the app. I'm really not keen on linking electronically and it helps me remain better informed of my money management. Very much recommend to anyone!

Grateful they don't ask to import your bank account details like other apps. It's simple to update and has an intuitive user interface. Not to mention, no unnecessary subscription fee. Definitely a good app if you just want an easy and clean way to collate your expenses. Only downside I'd say is working with the budgets can get confusing if you're working it payday to payday and not a strict month (I.e. 1st to 31st)

I love that everything is entered manually. It really slows you down which I feel helps manage budget more effectively since you have time to think about your expenses on a day to day. Instead of shopping on autopilot. If paid version included split categories within a transaction, I would consider buying it

Absolutely phenomenal. This app is completely free and has zero ads, which is incredibly rare. It delivers a seamless experience that other apps charge for. I'm so impressed that I'll be purchasing the pro version as soon as I can to support the developer's fantastic work. They've given us something of real value for free; it's only right to give back. Highly recommended.

Great app! It gives you a clean interface and not bombards with ads. Appreciation for the developer but one thing it lacks is to create a backup in any cloud. I recently lost data of my last one and half years because my phone got damaged. Now, I want my data back but there no any way I can get. I had created a local backup but since I can't access my phone it is gone.

This app is exactly what I have personally been looking for, and I found it out of the blue while surfing through other finance/budget apps. This fit my personal needs in a budgeting app, I've tried others like rocket money which is also good but was not exactly what I was looking for. I encourage you, to try this app for your digital budgeting and financing. Oh and did I mention its FREE!?

If you like to be hands on with your budget this is the app for you. It's free. No annoying ads and it allows you to be as detailed as you would like. So easy to use. Highly recommend:) update- I did not realize I already posted a review. I have had this app for over a year now and I still am very pleased. very easy to use, many different categories. Being hands on with my finances with the help from My money has taught me so much about my spending habits and I'm very grateful.:)

This app is a very it's a wonderful way to track your if you're trying to stay on a budget so you know always how much you're spending it's very simple to use the best part is that you can take it with you and you never need a pencil or a piece of paper or a calculator if you not adding in your head as you go I would highly recommend this app definitely user friendly

This is a great little app to track everyday spending for budgeting purposes. It's set up to be able to track all expenses (mortgage/rent, utilities, etc.), but I only use it for things like clothing, medical, food, personal care, etc. I'll probably upgrade to the pro version at some point.

Great app, simple UI , no ads , no unnecessary content, simple and customisable App. love it! what if two accounts can be linked so the overall dashboard of household expenses is visible. For example if two members are putting expenses in their own device and then the data could sync. just a suggestion! overall great app

Does everything you need it to do without being overly complex. I like that it does not connect to my banking. You could pay for the full version but that mostly unlocks extra icons: the free version is more than sufficient for most budget needs.

Loving this app! Everything I need. Allows me to track my spending across a multitude of different categories and provides me with the stats needed to analyse my spending easily. All without having to share personal information. This is going to make such a difference to my budgeting and spending. Great app. thanks!

I've loved using this app. It has a very clean layout and is easy to use and track my expenses. My only complaint is that I wish there was a way the app could automatically apply recurring payments each month (or however often), such as monthly subscriptions. I know it can be done manually, but it would save time and make it more efficient to use.

Really helpful app for budgeting, and tracking what I'm spending on. Giving 4 stars, as I think it would be useful to have a recurring option for regular outgoings rather than having to create from scratch each month, eg, for bills & rent that go out every month at the same amount.

Nice and decent app.. If you can manage to track expenses and incomes through graphs üìâüìä relative to previous months and years and also integrating an agent/bot which NOTIFIES the user to limit his/her expenses, incomes and transfers at the end of every month or year. That would be Excellent!!üëçüôå

one thing is missing: notes added to expenses or income is not shown in main page but you to have to open that particular expense or income to see the note. There must be option to show notes in main page along with category and amount so that one can know where that money has been spent. dev please add this feature. this is must for everyone.

This app is close to everything I need. Easy to enter data, nice display and good customization if so desired. One feature I'm wanting is the ability to either break time down into fortnightly sections or be able to customize by a date range. This would allow easy tracking of expenses vs income over a pay period rather than over a week or months. Would sign up to the pro version if it allowed this feature.

I've been using this app 4yrs and counting and am still loving it. Thank you for making it free until dateü§ó My initial review in 2021 ‚û°Ô∏è This is the best finance app I have come across and it's easy to use, free and the UI appeals to me greatly. I have installed and uninstalled lots of related apps and this is just the best and the exact specifications I needed and the best part? No ads!!!! You rarely see good apps without ads and I hope they don't change this amazing appüî• Thank you so much!!

Cole coded organization that allows me to track spending, earnings, and categorize by type of earnings and types of spending. I can add notes, check via month/day. I can set a budget and view my pie chart of spending. It is easy and user friendly!

Incredible. This is the best app I've found for balancing books and tracking multiple accounts. I only wish there was a way to check off whether a payment has gone through on the actual account, and also to add scheduled payments and decide whether or not they affect your totals (like a toggled setting or something)

I used this app for a long time, and to be honest, it was very easy and comfortable to use. I just have a complaint regarding the Background colour.If you can change the background from yellow to white it would look enhanced.

I really love and appreciate this app. It is the first time that I keep a money management app for more than a month on my gadget. I would just like to request for an accessibility via Web or having the options for it to sync even with payments or subscription.

I've been using this money tracking app for a few months now, and it's made a noticeable difference in how I manage my finances. The interface is clean and intuitive, making it easy to log expenses and categorize them. I especially appreciate the visual breakdowns‚Äîcharts and graphs that help me see where my money is going.

I really like the My Money app because it's convenient and easy to maneuver. Even the free version is enough for my needs‚Äîno need to go Pro! I can easily check my account statements anytime, which makes managing my finances so much simpler.

happy to encounter this app. really helpful to keep me on tracing the money flow smoothly. undoubtedly will continue using this forever. i just switched to a new phone and found the way to keep using the same app with backup and restored file. if i need to start all over, i wouldn't come back for sure

I needed a free app to record cash expenses, download this one and I'm happy with it, its easy and quick to imput daily spend, no gimmicks, exactly what i need it for. If it could be shared with one other person would be even better. Many Thanks!

This is very convenient and handy as a pocket diary. When I feed my transactions into .my computer at the end of the day I forget many items. This app is a great help as I can record each and every transaction at the instant

I liked it a lot! Finally something simple as I just needed it to keep track of my expenses. But when it subtracted the sum I used via CreditCard from the cash! No, it's useless for me this app. The Card expenses can't be subtracted from the cash!

It's very easy to use and I like the fact that I don't have to link my accounts. Manual, yes but remember the old days where our parents did this using a checkbook??? ü´£ Also... win for no ads!!! That's a rarity these days. Overall, awesome app and I'm excited to continue using it to balance my finances.

Best app for managing Daily expenses. you can categorize Income accounts and expense type. Can Add Icons for each category. The best part is, it is super easy to add expenses. While adding expenses you choose account type and expense category. Minimal UI, and easy to use.

Great app for tracking finances but I do wish there was a way to log where you spent the money instead of putting each expense into a bucket for example if I get McDonald's that's budgeted as a want but if I also buy a video game I also budget that as a want but at the end of the month I wanna see where all my money landed in each category instead of just seeing that I spent extra on wants I want to see exactly where I spent the excess

i really love this app!! being so neat and lite is what an app about. i like how the feature made me want to keep track of where my money went. it's fun seeing my account balance. i have an idea tho.. maybe the developer can add icon to add image for the notes, so i don't have to type all of item one by one in my shopping list. and so i can also add pictures of my food, etc. big thankss ‚ù§Ô∏è

Really like how it didnt have any ads, actually Ive been using it for years but I rediscover it again. btw it would be nice if you could add feature to hide the amount for certain account from the total amount. Because I would like to ignore that money in my saving but when doing the calculation again I know where it is

Love this app. Exactly what I need. 1 feedback. In every calendar, Week starts from Sunday and ends on Saturday. But in this app, week starts on Monday and ends on Sunday. this makes its slightly inconvenient as it does not sync with my other weekly trackers. Can this please be fixed or user given an option to set start and end of their week.

Very nice. Simple, easy to use, good layout. Makes tracking spending and income easier to keep up with. I love the option to set automatic reminders to update money flow. I wish the budgeting tool had more to it, but other than that, it's a good place for beginner type money tracking.

could have more sorting features from a particular date to the other. also could have features to sum the amount spent on a particular filter, let's say i search for every transaction where a particular description is mentioned or a category, i would like an option to show the + and - and net of those expenses, in a time frame in a particular category. these features are something that would be really handy and useful. Would love to see them, at least in the premium version....

Very useful to track my daily expenses as well as monthly total spending. Even though this version is free, it has kinds of customization to add additional payment methods , items, etc.Love this app and it is one of my daily apps for sure. Thanks to developer who works hard and share with community as free.

This app is great. Unlike other apps, it has a good UI/interface along with all the required functionalities. The only drawback (and a considerable one) is that this doesn't have an online sync ability. You can't connect your Google account which in this time period is available on almost every app. This significantly impacts experience. The developers should seriously consider adding that. Including it in the pro version would drive more people to purchase it as it is totally worth.

Love this app! Makes budgeting so easy. Clear layout, with different options to view spending habits. (E.g. analysing 'expense overview' as a pie chart.) You can choose icons to represent each expense/income category, which is very visually appealing. I would definitely recommend this app, for any stage of your life üòä

Love it, so far its done what I've wanted, I just wanted something to easily visualize my expenses. Manually putting them in, makes me realize my spending habits. I have another app I use that does it for me in a wheel-like format. This is just more my style.

Excellent app. Keeping a track of daily expenses and incomes has been made easy, thanks to this app. All we need to do is make the entries on time, after which it's easy to keep a track of transactions on a daily or monthly basis. I would definitely recommend this app to everyone.

I enjoy using the money app and I have recommended to friends. The beautiful thing is I could back up and restore to a new phone However I would if they make the backup go to an email instead of a back up file. if the phone spoilt totally nko... well done. I like how I can see the analysis of my spending and income.

I like it for its simplicity and built in calculators. And also mostly free with no ads, that much is a plus for me. I hope for future update, the time setting can be changed to 24 hour system that I preferred to use rather than AM-PM.

It's good. But I still struggle with the UI. I'm more inclined to a spreadsheet format that can give a summation for the month. Some vital expense categories are missing, but at least they can be manually added.

This is the best money tracker app I've tried. It's easy to use and it's ad free. I would give it 5 stars if there were subcategories. For example, I have a few streaming services. It would be nice if I created a category for streaming, then subcategories for the ones I have so they'd be grouped together. This would make it easier to see where and on what I'm spending my money. As it stands, I have to create a category for each one, and then they're separated on the expense analysis page.

It's only been a week and so far I'm finding it very good to help me keep in my set budget, allowing me to save faster and easier. I purchased the Pro Version now to help support the developer and wanting to keep seeing development and updates to continue making a most robust app. Thanks!

just installed. so far so good. the interface, the fonts, icons and Organisation is fantastic. I gave 4 star just in case I discover a bug after I rate it. I will return in two months to give a more on hands rating.

This app is underrated. It's so simple to use and intuitive in its functions. Works better than the majority of tracker apps I've used. Just need to have Google logins so I can have data across different devices and it'd be complete.

Best App for tracking Expenses. Please Add Some Features Like Specific Date to Date Income And Expenses . Because many users in India are not get their sailery on month's 1st date. easy to use. type an amount, choose payment type and, category to save amount. shows total for current month and for app use. I'm on my second month of using it. I track the amount I spend on uber going to work.

Overall app is simple. Suggestions for improvement for better User Experience, - When we change month & click on plus icon, calender should open by default of that selected month & not just current month, it's much helpful when adding past transactions. - Data saved locally is good way to save data rather than saving on unknown cloud, but auto backup to google drive from app will also be good. Great and simple app that allows me to track my disposable income balance on the go! As I make purchases, I just add expenses in the app and I always know how much I have left. Highly recommend!

Best App I Ever Found for managing my Expenses and Incomes ..... Just want to give one Suggestion....if you can add the net balance of everyday at the top of the last transaction of that day i mean if i have done 2 trades today then at the last transaction i will get to know my overall balance at that particular times

This free (My Money) is great for tracking my expenses. I put my monthly budget in it and know how much money I have for me for the rest of the month, then update my expenses as I go. I plan to buy the upgrade.

It's very helpful to manage our money by setting the month budget by categories expenses like need, want, car etc But one thing I like to suggest, kindly make it link with our gmail account so that we can back up our data regular basis so that we can switch in device easily.

Awesome visualization tool for keeping track of separate account and money allocation in them. If you can, make it a habit to log your transaction, it will prove to be great as a reference when your finances get scrambled.

one thing that would help a lot is to have the option to make things recurring. rent, car payments, insurance, salary. these are all recurring. I'm shopping around for the most user friendly app, this is one deciding factor

All in one app. I may support in future once I can manage. One suggestion - could you add an option to add receipts as well through camera or gallery? Not at the front because then it would be too intrusive, but as a side icon maybe....

almost perfect. I like how monthly budgets for each category can be set but it can't enter negatives. if I return something I bought it shouldn't be considered income, it should go back into the categories budget
Great app. Nice UI. Provides option to backup into Excel and CSV. Many categories are listed for income or expense. You can keep tab of money flow for each day. Even provides statistics. Recommended.

Very happy with the app. It's has been an eye opener concerning our expenses. I appreciate the simplicity and dont mind daily entries -doing so keep me aware, alert or alarm! It is a very simple yet powerful app. Very easy to use. I only wish we could generate account wise reports instead of all the accounts put together in one report. Hope this is taken care of in the future updates.

content: I have tried quite a few Expense Manager apps, but this, by far, is the simplest one. It is not very colourful or attractive like some other popular ones, but it definitely servers its purpose. Why i like this app the best is that it allows me to create multiple accounts and add as many subcategories as I want, without having to subscribe to a premium membership. Plus, I find it easy to navigate within the app, which makes the user experience pretty good.

Pros  There is no auto entry by reading SMS. Its good feature. i fade up using application with auto entry, but they misregister entries and we simply keep on editing those. In a i usually not do more than 4-5 transactions, logging them at night at once is rather easy.  Cons and Suggestion  1 along with monthly budget if there would be an option to set annual budget as well, it would be great.  2 if you can add sub-sub category option in expenses, it would be help. as i divide my monthly salary in monthly expenses, annual expenses and savings. but than each of them have sub sub categories.  3 if you can add option for an daily alarm for logging the transactions, it would be helpful, cause mostly i forgot to add them.  Kudos to the team

content: Literally one of the best apps I've tried so far!! 1. Interface is easy to use, but u can add more complex elements if u want 2. WIDGET- There's a simple widget u can add to homescreen that makes adding transactions easier on the go 3. Stats- Very well-presented stats that can help u get a better picture of ur expenditures 4. It's free! Most of the useful features are free which I appreciate a lot #cons (only one actually): all transactions have to be manually inputted.

The app is well-designed and useful, but it‚Äôs missing an important feature: the ability to share expenses with another person. Adding this would make tracking joint spending much easier. it can be solved by login system. Currently, the app only allows signing in via Google, which automatically adds my account to my partner‚Äôs phone when they log in. This is inconvenient and raises privacy issues. It would be much better if the app offered a traditional login option (email/username.

The app is very user friendly and UI is very well designed. There should be an option to add investments which should be separate from account balance. Currently if i want to add FD i can add it as an expenses(which will deduct from my added income) or income(this will increasemy total i come). But it won't come under any of these. Therefore a separate option is needed is what i think

Damn. After using notion, and a couple of other expense tracking apps this is, hands down the best expense tracking app, period. I was so pissed that I can't have custom budgets with other apps to the point that I was about to start developing my own app. I really loved all the micro-details, that the team paid attention to, hats off to the devs. The multi-budget feature with so many customisations is why I would like to pay for the premium membership. Thanks for building the app.

The best app for money management with all the essential free at free of cost. Can't believe all these features are free while other apps charging so high price with less attractive UI than this. The best part is it sync your data without much hassle using your Google account drive. The only downside of the app is its consuming a little more battery than usual when I compared which can be improved but it's unnoticeable.

So far so good! I had been tracking my spending on a simple note on my phone for years and then found you could use Excel on the phone too...but that was frumpy! Went searching for apps, downloaded a few. Many riddled with nuisance ads, others didn't have a smooth operation, organization or functionality I was seeking. Then came across Cashew the next morning. So far, this has been a revolution from my note and likely to make a full replacement after this pay cycle test! Nice app team!!!

While searching for any transaction with a specific amount, there is no option to manually enter than amount to search. Edit: Sorry, I should've been clearer. The slider is accurate, but for me the slider range goes between -100k to 500k so I'm not able to narrow down the amount I want to search (thick slider) Edit 2: Thanks to the developer for quick responses and for the hard work they put into the app. Updating rating from 4 to 5 stars.
replyContent: Hi there! In the next update you will be able to manually enter the high and low ranges for accuracy. Please consider updating your review to 5 stars if you enjoy the app. I have worked very hard on developing this application for everyone. I would appreciate it! Thank you :)

content: App interface and someof the functionalities are really good. Although some of them like bill splitter are really not straight forward to use. I wish there was an easy way to do so. I also wish there was an easy way to track my credit cards expenses , payments and refunds to those cards along with their billing cycle. Just stopped buying the full version because of this missing feature.

It's awesome. Main feature I liked is the ability to import multiple transactions using given template so that even if I miss to add transactions daily for many days, it's easy to enter it in google sheet and import it here. I have paid an annual subscription for Wallet app 3 months ago and now I am regretting it. It's also a good app, but this type of import feature and some other features are missing in it.

content: BY FAR the best budgeting app I've ever used. This has all the features all the other ones don't, literally for free. It does have a premium version, but it is extremely cheap ($1.49 a month), and it's really just for some more customizability features. Also worth mentioning a tutorial would be nice for new users.

content: Great app for tracking expenses and more. Have a small suggestion that, if you could add an option to automatically read balances and spends from SMS, that would be great. It would really help to notice every spendings and balance. Users just have to add the category or title then. Please add this feature if possible (seen in Microsoft SMS Organizer).

Setting up Cashew takes some time and you have to manually enter every time. But the UI is neat and clutter free. It is built with a Material You theme. It has already inculcated the habit of jotting down my transactions and makes it convenient to record subscriptions. You can export as well as import CSV file of transactions. While I won't ideally advise the import, the export is solid and can be backed up on Google Drive too. Go for the Pro subscription as you get a good number of features!

Add this option if possible, as I think this will be much helpful to track, instead of doing Expense - Income to get the actual expense. Or else you allow to enter both negative and positive values in both income and expense. Thnx for developing this wonderful application.
