Only had it a few days, but I'm really enjoying it! I've been able to set up budgets and get things set up as I wanted. I'd love the option to simply add money to the goals instead of transferring it out to the goal. Makes it a little confusing for me with the accounts that hold it and adds more money than I've got, but I have a workaround for that. maybe I've just not found the correct way if doing it,haha. AIreally useful app and definitely worth paying for if you're able to purchase it!

This is a great app! It's more than fully functional with a great UI, with a fair plus cost and lots of customization and no ads. I have one minor comment (request?) and that's that I would love to see more functionality with transfers. It would be useful to schedule and assign goals to transfers; i.e. if I have a recurring transfer set up into a savings account with my bank, it would be great to be able to schedule it, or assign money towards a goal when moved to savings.

Super flexible, allows subscriptions, repetitive payments and automatic payments. Appearance is great, really well laid out, completely free too. Can set multiple goals, types of goals, different budgets and accounts, and different transaction categories. Automation for categories as well, it recognises past transactions and can exclude certain categories from different budgets. Pretty easy to set up, much better than other paid apps. Even has account balance transfer.

This app is just perfect. I was looking for something less basic than what I was using, and this is the only one I've found that ticked all the boxes! It doesn't link to the bank account, and it doesn't require a subscription just for basic use. The free version actually has everything, but if you do need the extra bits, the cost is so worth it. I love all the categories and subcategories, I can now properly track my spending.

i have been looking for a budget friendly app for dummies, aka, people who don't want to put in the effort to calculate the expenses for the month! After messing around with the app for a few minutes, I immediately got the life time pro and worth it! I'm glad the app lets me sync to Google so if my phone dies, I'll still have my account and everything. the money tracking app is cute, simple, and gets the job done. :}

Really love the app. Interface is sleek and smooth. All the data is easily available and understandable. The bill splitter can be improved. Instead of just one bill. I want to add a group (like a vacation or a trip) where anyone of the group is paying some amount for something (like food or travel) and that amount can be divided on all of the group members orr any smaller number of members. At the end, bill splitter should give amount owed to and by all members.

Brilliant app and beautifully made. When I had an issue importing my historical transactions I managed to email the lead developer who helped me directly. Other than a few times where I have had to load from a backup due to trying to sync across multiple devices, I have absolutely zero comments for improvement. Will be upgrading to premium soon.
replyContent: Glad it helps you out and I‚Äôm glad I could help! Thanks for the review and happy budgeting :)

content: This is a fantastic app. It has all the essential features you'd need in a budget app, as well as a few convenient extras, all for FREE - and presented by a beautiful and intuitive interface. However, there is no bank sync. Not a dealbreaker for me though, as I prefer manual entry. Additionally, if you want to upgrade to unlock more features, the subscription is priced $1.49/mo, which imo is super reasonable. Plus, $20 gets you lifetime access so you're not stuck in a monthly subscription loop.

This is hands down one of the best budgeting apps, it is fully customizable, from the color to the homepage to the bottom tabs, anything can be changed, removed or rearranged to only show what's important to you, no other app gives you this much control. It can also adapt to your favorite budgeting method, from a 50/30/20 to a zero based budget and many others. it's free and free of ads. Only feature missing is Bank connectivity. Hope it's on the developers future plans.

This app is amazing. I love all the features for it being free. I am considering purchasing the full version, even. But I like how you can manually enter and edit transactions and budgets versus linking your accounts and having things just set. Sometimes things need to be edited, and on other apps you can't add notes or make edits as easily as with Cashew. Highly recommend.

I've tried several budget tracking apps but they're always too simple, too complicated, or impossible to use without a subscription. cashew is perfect for me! not too complicated, you can use it perfectly well without a subscription. I did end up getting it tho so I could add several budgets I wanted to track. I'm a big fan so far!

This app is REALLY powerful when it comes to options for your budgeting. I have the subscription on the app which is really cheap, only 1.47US, you won't even feel bad for such amount when you have this lifesaver. In the budgeting section I did the 50/30/20 rule, therefore I have 3 budget sections. When you're going to create a budget, PLEASE read the instructions, I was stuck for more than 2h trying to configure one of the sections so that it acts how I wanted. Click (?) once in the budget part

This app is pretty good. No need to look anywhere else if you want an offline budgeting app without any fuss. Lots of customizations. Categories, sub categories. You can also schedule reoccurring payments. Lots of charts and graphs to better view the data, filter transactions, view month or category wise transactions. Only issue I faced that after purchasing the app, if feels sluggish and slow. It was not an issue when using free version. It could be my phone but I am using Pixel 9 pro.
replyContent: Apologies for the issues. The app uses a rendering engine reliant on a modern graphics processor. Feel free to reach out on email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com for support and I‚Äôd be happy to provide a refund. Please consider updating your review to better reflect the app as a whole. I have worked very hard in developing it for everyone. Thanks!

content: It is quite a good app. I just wish there would be two more features. 1. I personally line to budget by putting money into a budget to spend, unfortunately that is only possible with goals. 2. I wish there would be an easier way for putting money in budgets and goals. It is possible with creating a new account and so on but I just wish I'd have one button where i can fill money into a budget and not having two accounts in the app for one existing account.

I've bought the lifetime subscription because I really love the app. I'm giving it 4 stars because it's still lacking the functionality to add transactions in different currencies for the same account. e.g. I am able to buy both in USD and local currencies with my credit card, but I can only add the transactions in USD, so I have to make conversions manually before adding them to the app.
replyContent: Hi there! Please see the FAQ regarding your query: https://cashewapp.web.app/faq.html#multiple-currencies If you have any questions feel free to reach out on email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com I‚Äôd be happy to help! If you enjoy Cashew consider updating your review to 5 stars, I would appreciate it :) Thanks!

content: Easy to understand and to add new entries. It would be nice for the monthly balance to carry forward though, and to make the text for each addition smaller, or to word wrap, so more of the entry title can be viewed at a glance. It's really good for a free, and ad-free, budgeting app though.

Difficult to use. Good concept but it's a lot of work to input everything. Might be better if you have very few categories or if you only need a budget for bills. I like how colorful it is though. **Edit** My categories kept defaulting to bills when I chose a different category for each budget so I had to edit my budgets whenever I opened the app
replyContent: Hi there! I‚Äôm not sure I understand the issue you are experiencing. When adding a transaction you can select the category. If you need assistance feel free to reach out on email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com Please consider updating your review to better reflect the app itself. I have worked very hard on developing it for all. Thanks!

content: I love this app so much! I've been using it since Mint went down but this is way better than mint. Quick suggestion: Reversing expenses. Like if an expense is refunded, it would be nice to have a way to reverse the entry. This would be great because it shows the expense like your bank transaction does. I would rather have a reversing entry than deleting the expense itself or putting in an "income" entry to reverse the entry. üòÅ

I really like the look of the app and it's quite easy to learn, I'm a "wallet" app user but it's very difficult to find an app with a look that can invite me to be more consistent in filling out money reports. I will buy the pro version after I get used to this app a little. I hope this app can develop even better than it is now. especially I really look forward to the web app in the browser being smoother Edit: Please Add more Widgets ‚ô•Ô∏è

Cashew is a great manual budgeting app. I love that I can keep an eye on all my accounts in one place and I love the graphs that show my spending and money trends. I also like that I can set my subscriptions and see them coming up and prepare when I look at my transactions. The only thing I wish was added is an option to add interest rates on the loan page. But I am very pleased with this budgeting app.

Ive tried a lot of budgeting apps and this has been the only one I stuck with. I don't need a ton of budgeting help and I didnt want a random app linking to all my accounts so manual input is a plus for me. While there is a paid version, unlike every other finance app that paywalls you, you can choose to not pay and still get access (But I havent needed the premium features), which is why I'm choosing to give the devs money and even writing this review. Thanks devs for making a great tool.

Good free app to track expenses. I currently don't have a stable job. I am unable to pay for a premium app. I keep tracking my expenses that are paid by cash through Cashew. It helps me be aware of how much I have spent monthly so I can be more careful about spending money next time. This app is really helpful since I don't like keeping receipts in my wallet.

I've been slightly annoyed by the daily prompt to ask me to buy premium, I have zero need for the premium version of this app, the free version provided everything for me and I'm sure most people. id rather pay 3 dollars for what you give for free, with no more prompts... like over a year later, I still can't stand the begging to buy premium when it's unnecessary, just add features, lower the price or make a tiny payment to just stop annoying me. good God

Actually free with no ads! Overall it has everything I need for simple financial management and to help know where my money is going. Haven't gotten a chance to try out all the features yet, but so far I like what I am using. Thanks for the great app! Some criticism: Would be nice to be able to set up default categories for each budget. Example: one of my budgets is food. It'll always be dining, but it requires you to select the category every time. Doesn't even allow you to skip it.

Love the app! Just figured out how to add bi-weekly payments, which has been super helpful. I don't love the loan option. Perhaps I have not grasped the concept of how to use it accurately as of yet. The one thing I would love to see added is a credit card option : balance / available credit / interest rate / bill date. I currently have it set up as an account + repeating transaction monthly.

Wonderful experience. Does everything you need it to do (besides maybe investments) for free, without ads, and in a pretty UI. (There's a web UI and sync too!) I get a tiny bit of stutters here and there, but it's worth it, even paying for the premium version (even though you can use paid features for free) is worth it just to support the developer.

Essentially perfect. I'd like to see in an update is the ability to hide an account from net total. This would be useful for savings accounts. I know it wouldn't technically be "net" total anymore, but you get the point. Other than that one suggestion, this app is amazing. I highly recommend it. Edit: this can be done through settings. Settings and customization > more options > total widget.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! This can also be done by long pressing the net total homepage section, or by editing the homepage section by tapping on it when editing the homepage. Happy budgeting :)

content: The UI of this app is impressive It's fluid animations & colour choices make it a joy to use. It also has a solid set of features, I particularly like the budgeting & subscriptions, and the transactions layout. I would love to give 5 ‚≠ê, but there are a few issues, transaction attachment only appear as hyperlinks, no thumbnails. Next, you can't add icons which would be useful for subscriptions e.g. icon for Netflix, Amazon... But the app is still great. Hope it continues to evolve

It has a lot of potential. I love the different currency, it has an automatic payment for income or expense so you avoid the manual log. Great app. Though I wish it had an option to add amounts to goals for when you already have a starting amount. Also be able to transfer money from an ACC to a goal, but count it as an expense from a budget not a global expense. I don't know if I'm explaining correctly. Either way, I'll keep it installed to see its future updates as I want to switch systems

Incredibly well-designed app and super helpful The one thing I'd change is that when I hit the plus icon for a transaction, I select the category and it automatically goes to the amount section. I have all the "Ask for x" options on, so I wish it would stay there so I can add a note or change the date. Also, a split the bill option like Splitwise does instead of an equal amount for each person would be incredible. Either way 10/10 best budget app üëç thanks for keeping it updated!

If you're after a simple budget tracker, this is it. Tried 15+ different apps that have different levels of intricacies, but this is perfect. The UI is straightforward and great to look at, and there's all the requirements anyone would need for tracking their finances. I really like the ability to create extra categories and sub categories, The ONLY thing I wish they did differently was the ability to add money from your accounts to a "goal" I setup a fake savings account to solve this though.

Great expense tracker! I switched from Bluecoins as it shows some signs of being abandonware and I'm so glad I found Cashew. For me, the most important things are support for multi-currency and web app, which is very useful. My suggestions would be: 1. Add Microsoft OneDrive as alternative option for syncing 2. An ability to typing the exact amount for transfers with currency conversion for the receiving account (as there are some deviations with exchange rate sometimes, as well as other fees)

I was able to import +5000 transactions from my original budgeting app, and it was seamless. I would give it a 6 star if I could, because this app is amazing, even for free version! I don't need the full option, but I'll pay for it just to support. I hope in the future that there's a functionality to read SMS messages and automatically make transactions - then it would be beyond perfection. Please consider!

Bumped it up to 4 stars after the developer responded quickly and explained some things. Instructions or help files would still be a +. The main reason I tried this was for downloading transactions from my bank. It is a little intuitive, but not enough to make a big impact. After some practice it is better, but it still takes a lot of time to prepare the bank file upload. Individual entries are fairly simple. No ads is a +. Customization is ok. I'll wait for the next update before a final rev
replyContent: Hi there! If you have trouble, I'd be happy to help on email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com. To import as an expense, make sure the amount is negative in the template, as in the example. I would really appreciate it if you updated your review to better reflect your experience. I have worked very hard developing Cashew and 5 stars would help me out :)

content: Great app! Only thing I noticed that needs fixing is how a certain repetitive transaction that falls under income category disappears after a few deposits. I deposit daily and then I notice it, which is not really a problem. Only thing I'm worried about is that if it happens to other transactions which I don't memorize so I'm afraid I might miss one.

Great app. Very nice way to figure out my finances and create a budget. I use this on my phone and tablet, so I need both to have the same information. Unfortunately, it sometimes takes some work to get them to sync together. It either won't sync and I'll need to backup on one device and restore on the other, will log out of my Google account, or it will take a while to sync. Not that big of a deal, just a minor annoyance. Still a great app. Worth the paid tier.

Best budgeting app Ive ever used! Took a day or so to setup, so It comes with a little bit of a learning curve but ultimately worth it. You can get even more out of the app by purchasing the pro version and they have subscription options but I would recommend the purchase for a lifetime which is currently only $20! Might seem steep to some, but if you are using this for budgeting a one time purchase to manage your money going forward is a small price to pay to secure financial freedom. 10/10!
replyContent: Thank you so much for the in-depth review Michael! Really appreciate the kind words, happy budgeting :)

content: Nothing better IMO. If it could sync with my local bank that would be awesome. But I don't think it lacks anything really. It has many options and ways to customise your experience with the app. I highly recommend this app. You can import data from your other apps. Categories have sub categories. Google sign in and back up. Charts. Negative accounts which I utilise for my credit card.

It's an amazing app! I was having issues tracking my finances, and this app was just what I needed. I love how you can categorize transactions with the cute icons, the pie chart that shows your expenditures, and just the general interface of the app. The free version is really, really nice. I 100% recommend you go for the Pro version if you have the money.
replyContent: Glad you enjoy the app and appreciate the recommendation towards the Pro version. Happy budgeting Vanessa :) Thanks for the review!

content: Love this app! I've tried so many different budgeting methods and apps and this one is finally one that works for my brain! It's easy to setup budgets, savings goals, track spending, etc. it's also nice that there are options for both subscriptions and reoccurring costs. I have some trouble syncing between my computer and my phone but other than that I can't complain!
replyContent: Hi Maggie, glad you love the features! If you enjoy this app consider updating your review to 5 stars, would really appreciate it :) I have worked very hard on developing this application for everyone!

content: Cashew is by far the best financial app I've tried. It's got everything you could want, and the design and UI is top-notch! My only suggestion is to add more subcategories for expenses. For example, under Groceries, it would be great to have options like 'Groceries > Fruits > Apples, Banana.' Right now, you can only add one subcategory, which can be a bit limiting. Overall, I'm so impressed with Cashew that I'm seriously considering getting the premium version.

It's a great app! Open source, no ads and no mandatory purchases. It's fully functional and has everything you could ask for. I love the customization options too, they're really good with the Material You option! I would, tho, add maybe a "shared" wallet, or a "spectator" mode so parents can see their kids expenses, or, when working on a "common" budget, add the "Teams" or "Family" option so that a wallet is shared across friends and families. Creating a transfer option would be nice!

So far so good. Just switched from Wallet (which I've used for over 14 years), because they keeping hounding me to get the paid version, limited how many accounts I could have, and display ads where the "X" is on different sides of the screen. So bye bye I went. Checked out Mint, Expensify, Clarity Money, Every Dollar, and a bunch more apps only to find that their "FREE" accounts were only free for like a week. Then it's $20/month or whatever. Ridiculous. This app seems to be perfect so far.

It's very pretty, but no tagging functionality makes it useless for me. I appreciate your response. However titles are titles, and they are not replacement for tags in any way. For example if I have a payment "restaurant" and want to tag it as split payment, should I call the transaction "restaurant split payment"? Then the next time I try to quickly add a restaurant expense it will autofill the split payment part as well.
replyContent: Hi Arthur, the app makes use it 'Titles' which provides even more flexibility when compared to tags. You can filter by multiple titles and combine as many titles as you'd like. Please consider updating your review to 5 stars, I have worked very hard on developing this application for everyone :) I would appreciate it very much, thank you!

content: I have been using this app for under 48 hrs and it has been so good compared to others I have used on the past. It takes a bit to make some of the customizations but very user friendly overall. The only add on I would prefer is to select payment method when entering an expense such as cash, which cc and so on. I saw the option for creating a different account to refer to CCs but I would not prefer it this way. Nonetheless, I have already upgraded to the pro version. Keep up the great work.

Genuinely the best budgeting app I've found, completely customizable and they don't make you link your bank account if you don't want to, and you can still use all the features, the "premium" version is also free, like they ask for a contribution but if you can't afford another subscription you can still set more than one budget and everything, the interface is also very very well designed and pretty intuitive, would recommend to anyone who wants to get their finances in check.

I wanted an app with a savings goal feature and my daughter put me on to this. I LOVE IT!!! It has loads of icons and free options to keep the app engaging. Thank you!!! UPDATE: The app was awesome, but now it's stressing me out. Even if I'm using ONE device, and backing up after every use, transactions are lost and accounts are no longer balanced. Twice last night I had to re-enter transactions. Balanced everything, backed up and double checked, yet this morning EVERYTHING is gone again.
replyContent: Apologies for the issues. It seems your syncing process was interrupted at some point and needs to be reset. Please see: https://cashewapp.web.app/faq.html#troubleshooting-syncing I‚Äôd be happy to help on email too: dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com Please consider updating your review to better reflect the app as a whole. Thanks!

content: This is the easiest budget app I've used. I was a bit disappointed that it didn't link up to my bank but it's better that it doesn't. I have to enter every transaction manually and it's making me more self conscious about where my money goes. If you want to start budgeting then this is the app for you! On an additional note, you get all the pro features for free and the pop ups aren't annoying either. I fully intend on paying for pro soon. The creators deserve the support.

I've battled with this app a couple of times, now, and finally going to admit defeat. If it wasn't for the fact that I've created an over the top spreadsheet that works everything out to a tee, including the actual money I have left to spend once all my bills are paid, then I would probably stick with this app. Syncs never work properly, backups don't transfer to the web app completely... I can't figure out loans for love nor money. Happy to subscribe for a year, but won't be using the app.
replyContent: Hi there! If you need any assistance, I'd love to help you out: dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com Syncing is not instant, only when refreshed/launch app. Backups can be loaded on any platform. Add transactions to long term loans to track your payments. Consider updating your review, I have worked very hard on developing this application for everyone :)

content: This is probably the best entry level budgeting app I've found till now. I didn't find anything wrong with it yet, although I'd love to see some features added in the future if possible. I personally think it could be a nice feature to add "sub-accounts". I have multiple chequing accounts and all my chequing transactions go in a single account on cashew. If we could add a sub account for people with multiple bank accounts so that we can see individual bank balances that would be amazing

4.5 üåü One of the best budget, spending trackers I've ever used (after extensive trials of at least 6). Very intuitive - no annoying or complicated features.Endless possibilities for creating categories & subcategories. The ability to set saving goals and budgets is a plus! I also used it while travelling to track how much i spend. Only one suggestion is the ability to archive accounts and categories (for ones we longer use but like to keep for reference).

Bought a lifetime license after trying it out for 3 months and comparing it to roughly ALL the apps in the store, haha. Keep up the great work! edit: corrected from 5 to 4 stars, because please don't fix what's not broken! I'm talking about the Pie Chart on the Home page. It was wonderfully minimal without the category names displayed. Now it just looks uglier - so now it's like in most of the apps in the store... Please at least consider adding the possibility to hide them!

Honestly, one of the best budget and expenses tracker ever. No ads, just completely free, but of course you can pay for pro version which is can be unlocked for free. So that makes it more like a donation to the hard working devs behind rather than buying the pro version. I'll definitely buy the pro version as a thanks to the devs who created this. The UI is user friendly and it's not complicated to navigate and setup. Ps. I'm also a Dart developer.
replyContent: Thanks for the review Joseph! Glad you enjoy the app :)

content: I love the customization with the app's appearance and with how you track your accounts. Seeing debt payments as a goal with progress towards it is helpful. Also, the attitude of this app is very positive. Premium features can be accessed without payment, since the developer(s) value financial stability. I will soon be subscribing when I'm able. The only downside to the app is you cannot link accouts like other apps, so you have to input your data manually, but it makes you see what you spend.
replyContent: Hi there! Cashew is focused on privacy. You should never share banking details with third parties. Cashew is designed so that adding a transaction is efficient and you become mindful of spending. There‚Äôs an API where you can auto add transactions as well. Consider updating your review to 5 stars if you enjoy the app - and happy budgeting :)

content: Excellent app. The existence of subcategories and flexibility of having a webapp is quite apparent. I love that there is thought put into exporting options and automation of backups as well. If there is anything that leaves to be desired, I would like to be able to create "Balance Correction" type of categories, and also have subcategory types for those.

App is feature-rich and a no-brainer to recommend to someone in need of budget management. My only "urks" on this app is that it doesn't have a centered icon for emojis, and that enabling the short number format is inconsistent (i.g. 1,234.56 gives me 1.23k where as 5,6789.10 gives me 6k rather than 5.7k). If I could also add a feature to this, it would be having the option to add a fee when transferring from 1 account to another.

I've been using this app daily for some time now. It is good and I really like it. The downsides are that some amount labels still keep confusing me, f.e the upcoming. The exchange mechanism doesn't have a custom field, within the transactions, where you can change the values. There are no reports and the synchronization between devices is performing poorly. Love the calendar, would be nice to have a homepage reminders widget!
replyContent: Hi there! The currency can be customized by heading to More > Accounts > Exchange rates. If you have syncing issues please see the FAQ https://cashewapp.web.app/faq.html#troubleshooting-syncing Keep in mind syncing is a 2 step process to ensure security.

content: Simple and easy, NO ADS!! I dont like connecting my bank account so this worked perfectly. If you want to use it to learn how to budget better and make small month to month goals, you can customize it ALOT! Info is presented super simply with graphs, charts, a savings/spending meter, and breaks down how much you can spend each day to stay on goal. It also sends reminders, very helpful to stay on task. Allows me to reevaluate my spending habits -- love a broke college student üòå

10/10 Recommend Budgeting Apps. It doesn't push ads every time you do something, the icons and simple animations feels like using an IOS app, there is several graphs and such which shows your spending and income in different ways. The only thing I'm discontented with is that I can't use 2 categories for 1 spending, like using 7/11 categories & personal care categories for a deodorant bought in 7/11 since the item encompasses more than 1 categories.

I came from Ivy Wallet since it is now discontinued. I'm already liking this app, but there's one thing that keeps me from switching, and that's when I try to import my data from Ivy Wallet. It is somewhat compatible, but it doesn't recognize whether the amount is expense, income, or transfer correctly. Hope it will be fully compatible in the future because I don't want to manually edit a thousand lines of data. Until then, I will keep on looking for a replacement.
replyContent: Hi! Included in the app is an Import Template. To support all platforms, this is provided to ensure uniform formatting. Income is positive and expense is negative. Please see: https://cashewapp.web.app/faq.html#import-csv-data There are also third party tools converting Ivy exports to this format. Feel free to email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com :)

content: I love this app so much. Straightforward and functional! Most importantly, it's basically free!! One of the major things I considered was the export and importing functions of expenses tracker app, and boy was I glad to find Cashew's to be perfect! Siging in is optional, you can export and export without issues, and or paying for anything! Once I am able to, I'm really looking forward on supporting the developers! Thank you so much!

I used to have 1Money App in my other phone, when I tried to download again, I discovered that disappeared. Now I found this one and got me crazy. It took me one day understand the feactures and the most important thing do everything that the other money apps don't. The debts, savings and projects, is simply awesome. Honestly I would pay the lifetime, but is the first time I do monthly bc I wanna support the developers.

Great for the tech savvy, saved me $700 this month. My partner and I have a joint email for TV apps, it's helped as we log into that email on both devices and it's syncs. However I'm not sure you can share between two users with different emails. It's handy both being able to add to the add and customise accordingly as we have different brand devices.

Best app for personal finances. It has everything you need! The only improvements I think it needs are the ability updates of the currency rates. For other currencies, they are not up to date. Moreover, planning transactions between accounts should be possible. To make it even better, you could add a feature that takes a certain percentage or amount from our income immediately when it is entered money to add to a budget or a savings goal. Make also a video on how to fully use it, please! Thanks!
replyContent: Hi! Set custom exchange rates in the app: More > Accounts > Exchange Rates. Exchange rates come from an external source. You can create upcoming transactions. There is an FAQ available on the official website. Please update your review to better reflect the app. I have worked very hard on developing this app for all, I would appreciate it. Thanks!

content: This app is amazing! At first I was having some issues, and I actually sent them a comment on it but quickly became embarrassed when it took me all but 5 extra minutes to realize I was just using the app wrong! üòÇ But over all it's made budgeting so much easier than imputing it on a spreadsheet, and I'm very pleased with it. And you can pay for it, but it looks like that's more of a donation type thing to aupport the developers

This app has most features of paid apps, and it's free! However, it also lacks some basic things, like labels for transactions (a transaction can only have one category/subcategory). There is also no straightforward way to see how much money you had in the account at a specific date, something I need for financial planning.
replyContent: Hi there! Cashew does tags a bit differently through titles. This gives users a more versatile tracking experience. To see money on specific days, use the All Spending Page, history tab. Consider updating your review to 5 stars if you enjoy the app! I have worked very hard on developing this application for everyone and would appreciate it :)

content: My best find in 2024! Excellent graphic and features, perfect for multi-device use. However, I've found that so far the sync speed between my tablet and my phone is rather slow. And also, I'd love an update on the calendar. It'd be perfect if I could access to it on the homepage, or on a main tab and easily see how much I spend and earn everyday right on the calendar without having to select a specific day to see the data. Anyways, keep up the good work!

The app is quite good and I love the fact that its open source. But it misses some features like it doesn't have an option to save account number with account name, no total balance option, also you should add the feature to set icons to account, also coloured dot isn't a good indicator, would love if there was a function to make the whole account card background colorful instead of a dot. Also it would be good to see all the accounts in the page without scrolling.
replyContent: Hi there, thanks for the review! Feel free to reach out dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com and we can talk! Account numbers aren't saved due to a feel of privacy concerns. I tried a full colored background, but it didn't suit the design. You can see you total balance and a vertical list of accounts - tap three dot in top right corner of the home page

content: It's definitely worth the full cost if you decide to do that, but it's also great free! This has been the first budgeting app that I've liked. I can keep track of loan payments budget for things and also put in future transactions and reoccurring transactions. I usually just use an excel sheet, but this is now my favorite budgeting app!

The app is really good and really attractive. I can appreciate the attention to design and how native it feels with latest versions of Android. I'd like to see the integration of native credit card support even though this usage can be simulated manually, but it would be great to be able to manage credit/debit cards intuitively. Also, I had a bug where I couldn't delete the first default account even if I marked another one as the default or favorite.

This app is literally the best in covering my needs. The only feature I think it's lacking is the ability to manually enter amount in BOTH currencies while adding transfer from account with different currencies. Exchange rate differs over time and depending on the bank I'm using + whether I'm buying or selling dollars, so I can't find it possible to enter everything correctly with current exchange rate feature implementation. Side note: extra graphs and stats would be great as well ü•∞

I found the auto-pay option for subscriptions, but it needs to be out in the other options instead of buried. what I need now is a recurring transfer between accounts. also not super clear how to make installment payments on loans, and there's a place for subs, but a place for recurring BILLS would be helpful. only update is that it's totally unclear how to do any of this if it's even possible and you need to create a comprehensive manual.
replyContent: Please understand to allow the app to be customizable, many settings must be included for every use-case. For reoccurring transfers, create a transfer and change its type to ‚Äúrepetitive‚Äù. For questions email dapperappdeveloper@gmail.com Please consider updating your review to better reflect the app as a whole. I would appreciate it, thank you!

content: This app is definitely a game changer..the reviews are 100%. I've been battling to find an app that's user friendly & straight to the point. It's really not so hard to figure out & I'm definitely going to subscribe. I finally managed to get my bookkeeping right for my small business[FOR FREE]. If you're as Lazy as myself to manage bookkeeping or keep track of any expenses used. This app is GOLD, a definite treasure. I'm over the moon literallyüôÇ‚Äç‚ÜîÔ∏èüôåüèΩ.

I really like this app! Once you get everything set up, I've found it very easy to use personally. I am a very beginner budgeter and so far this has been very helpful and fairly easy to use! I would definitely recommend using this app. And for a premium version it's literally a $1 a month or $15 for life time access. If you're wanting to get into budgeting, I'd check it out!

Nice app, but it could have more features. Edit** I appreciate the app. It is useful and affordable. Things I would prefer: 1. Bank integration for automatic updating. 2. Goals being able to be tied to accounts. (E.g, If a particular savings account is established for a goal, transferring money into the savings account from a checking account would update the goal status. 3. Being able to share access with my wife without a joint email address being required.
replyContent: Hi Austin! Cashew is meticulously designed so every aspect of bookkeeping budgeting is covered by all the features without adding unnecessary confusion for the majority of users. I hope you can recognize all the design decisions and hard work that went into developing it all. Consider updating your review to 5 stars, I would appreciate it :) Thanks

content: This is genuinely the best app that I have come across, visually appeasing, doesn't feel limiting or restrictive, premium features don't feel like it's forcing you to pay to continue using it for everyday uses, actually have an option for a one-time payment in an age of never-ending subscriptions with no lifetime payments. Definitely will be paying for pro in the future to support the developers!!

I'm over the moon with this app- it's exactly what I was looking for in terms of a budget tracker for myself. I am using the widget so that every time I make a purchase or want to budget I can plan for it and track it and it's going to make my spending so much more conscious and I cannot wait to enter more data into it so that the features can be used to their max. I didn't need a tutorial because the userinterface is brilliant and its so customizeable! Well done devs!

amazing... 100% recommend for beginner.. it's simple and all features are useful and not too complicated but still cute (personally like colors and not super minimalistic apps) although I am baffled with how to transfer money into specific goals without it having to add to the net worth... I'm currently on a saving goal and I would prefer to isolate the amount of money inside the goal rather than adding it to the net worth...Still, it is good! Loving it!

Great app! I would love to have the option to display the categories directly in the 'Home' section. Right now, I have to click the '+' button first to select a category and add a transaction, which feels a bit inconvenient. Having quicker access would really improve the user experience.

Quite possibly one of the most compete and functional apps for managing your transactions in the classic style of "I'll do it myself" I've ever seen. The great design and FREE syncing with WEB APP makes this an absolute pleasure to use!! This honestly shouldn't be free, and if there's a lifetime option (or perhaps a subscription) that you should have, this is it.

This is a fantastic app! Something built with such exhaustive features and a clean UI for free - will definitely pay up once I become a regular user! A couple of additions that can really make it more effective would be - a search bar for account selection - giving every account a type (loan, credit card, bank account, debit card etc) and; - using sub Accounts (using dc deducts from a bank account), which currently I transfer balance for all DC and UPI accounts at end of month.

Hey dev(s) of Cashew. Just wanted to say thanks for making this app, as it is easy to use and very pleasant on the eyes. With it, it's starting to sink in how much debt I have due to things outside of my control. I know, it could've been any other budgeting app, but yours was the one I kept installed because of it's design and it not asking for any login information. Thank you, and I promise that when I'm in a better spot, I'll sub to the premium version.

Best budgeting and spending tracker for me. I don't usually buy subscriptions or memberships but I bought a lifetime one for Cashew. It would be great if you can add a credit card feature where I can put my credit card limit and enter payment to the credit thennit will reset the credit card limit to max. Budget and credit card spending should be separate.

Detailed yet easy to follow up, track and monitor. Also very customisable, love it! I was hoping to reach out to your customer support, I have a little issue with paying a lifetime purchase, which I intend to buy, but a have a little problem from my side. Once again, awesome app!

amazing app nothing is blocked if you don't pay and not connected to your banking app which personally in the world of leaking information makes me feel safer. The UI is just great and super intuitive which is a lot to ask these days. Honestly just grab it it's 100% free and if you like it pay the tiny subscription or the one time fee ( I know I will). OH ! and it's open source I know I won't do anything with it but I love the message it gives !!!

Great app, Takes a bit to get to know all the options and settings. Love that it is 100% and no ads. However, it would be nice if I always could use sub categories instead of main ones so i can plan better budgets. Would also be nice if accounts had Jars so i can better see how much money is sitting for a specific purpose. All round an amazing app!

This app has been absolutely phenomenal. Over and above its fantastic offering, I love that it allows you to use all features for free. It shows a true dedication to improving use, and not gate-keeping budgeting from those who need it the most. I am looking forward to start paying for the service if I use it consistently for 3 or so months.

As a person with adhd, this is the first app that really works for me. My favorite feature is being able to keep track of multiple accounts in different currencies. The app gives me the overview I can't get by myself. Great app!! You have free access to all features, but I will start paying this month because the people who made this deserve it.

Been looking through various wallet apps and I think I found the one. This is Open-Sourced, looks awesome, is extremely customisable, works 100% without subscriptions and without ads.. it seems too good to be true, someone pinch me! Will be trying it for a few weeks, and if all's well I very much would love to fully subscribe to this app.

Good, but not great. I moved back to my old app. While the UI looks fresh, the process of adding multiple expenses in a row is not very convenient. The app is sluggish and poorly optimized (Pixel). The Web App is even more slow and sluggish (on an M4 MacBook Pro!). You need to sign in with Google each time you want it to sync with your phone. Moreover, it's just a rendering of the phone app onto a browser with slight changes to layout.
replyContent: To address your concerns: Adding transactions is optimized and efficient, with minimal information prompts. Cashew runs an SDK that relies on the performance of the host device. The web app is optimized for larger screens with careful planning of layout and usability. Please consider updating your review to better reflect the app as a whole. Thanks

content: I deeply deeply appreciate the ability to use the premium features for free, and because of that I'm wondering if it would be possible to add the ability to tip, or if there's any way to donate, to cover for those who can't pay? - unrelated suggestion, when tapping "pay" on reoccurring expenses, it would be nice to have a "paid on time" option or have it ask when you paid.

I got to tell you all that I LOVE THIS APP! I just started my unversity life and i first started off with pen and paper for budgeting but after moving to this app, is THE BEST THING that could happen! I tried out other budgeting apps too! But most of them were paid and not necessarily the one you'd need for just normal budgeting. This app is literally THE best for it as it not only track but provide with easy and simple UI such as piechart of your spending and etc!! Simply fantastic!!

Got the lifetime version since the app is just what I want to manage my finances. A few caveats throughout my usage. Credit Card payments are not very intuitive. There should be a separate payment type only for CC. The amount should show up as debit borrowed in budgets. If we set type to Borrowed, it considers it credit which is incorrect. The widget with Account balance shows cumulative balance in all accounts, can the in app filter be applied to the widget to show only one account's balance?
replyContent: Thank you Yash! Really appreciate the review :) Glad you enjoy using Cashew!

content: This is an amazing app. It has a very straightforward interface to log the spending. I also really like the customised icon subcategory features. I would love to see if it can add features such as joint spending rather than having to log them down separately. I would also love a feature for enabling tracking my spending budget per month against my income instead of just the total saved income across all months.

This app has everything I want in a budgeting app and it's simple to use. The only thing it doesn't do is connect to accounts for automatic updates, but I prefer that; I just don't like things touching my bank account unnecessarily. The upgrade to pro is 20 dollars for lifetime too!

Really like this app and paid for the lifetime Pro version. Does almost everything you would want and really well with an amazing UI. The only addition I would like it the ability to set the period for your various budget categories in bulk rather than having to do it one by one which is annoying if your payday fluctuates each month.

Exceptional functionality. The cards showing different stats is really good. The UI is good. A suggestion to be able to add the actual icons as images or icons such as for subscription services like netflix, google, youtube etc, bank accounts, categories and online shopping apps etc.

Just started using it yesterday, I like it. Will get the lifetime subscription in a couple of months. Hope to see new features like sync with daily transactions but not automated, a dasboard for investment / savings portfolio, and maybe an inbuilt calculator. Anyways, good app. Please don't over clutter with unnecessary stats or ads. 5 stars!

Very well designed and also easy to use, you could make your custom categories, you can also create custom accounts, analytics is good, graphs charts etc, also the UI is great, works for both personal as well as for small business use, works great for my small company. Love it so much! ‚ù§Ô∏è Thank you to all the designers! üòä (the subscription is also affordable) My suggestion - Must include sign in options, for using different accounts (like for using it for my personal and business use). üëç

A very good app for personal finance tracking. Just to add some more functionality. Please add daily savings goal tracker in this So I can track how much saving left to reach my goal. Also add report for it too like avg daily saving  Avg weekly saving, avg monthly savings, amount to reach to goal (daily, weekly,  monthly) like that. If you add that just ping me by replying this. Thank you

The best UI for any money tracking app. Two suggestions that I would like to make - 1. The ability to add a short description of the income/expense/transfer that occurs to keep note of the context of spending/earnings. 2. Investments as a category similar to income/expense/transfer and types of investments as subcategories so that they are not misinterpreted as spendings
replyContent: Hi Raghunath, you can add notes by pressing note button while creating a transaction. It's located above done button at bottom right corner. Thanks for your feedback.

content: I've been testing it and wish it had these 4 features: 1. A transaction button in home tab for quicker access. 2. Grouped account listings, like categorizing credit cards, bank accounts, wallets, etc., both while viewing accounts and recording expenses. I manage over 20 accounts, and it‚Äôs challenging to find the right one when adding a transaction. 3. A sneak peak of total assets vs total liabilities based on the accounts added. 4. Red color text for negative balance in accounts view.
replyContent: Thanks for feedback! TrackWallet is still being actively worked on, so hopefully you will see these features added in future updates. Stay tuned!

content: This is a great application, have been using it from last 1 year(even more). Great UI, awesome experience - take these 5 stars for it. But, there is one use case that should be considered here for free users, if I want to change my device I will be losing on all the data which I have entered on this app of more than 1year. How would I be able to transfer it to the other device? As I want to change my mobile phone, what options do I have? Thanks again for this wonderful application!
replyContent: Thanks so much for the 5 stars and for sticking with TrackWallet! Right now, the backup feature is only available in the premium version, which allows switching phones. I know it‚Äôs an important feature, so I‚Äôll keep it in mind. Thanks again for your support!

content: Just started trying this app. So far, I like it. I needed a replacement for the 1Money app (android & IOS friendly) as google took them off the Play Store. I need a backup app in case they go completely off line. The TrackWallet app is easy to use, I can see all my 'accounts' on one screen. would be nice if the view was single line with balances and available credit. Also, would be helpful to have a debt or loans tracking to see payoff balances. Would also be great to have as IOS friendly.

With 1Money shutting down (along with my lifetime subscription), I‚Äôve been searching for a worthy expense-tracking replacement. TrackWallet is the closest I‚Äôve found and almost perfect! However, the lack of an import function means I can't transfer my data, which is a major downside. üòû Another feature I‚Äôd love to see is a web version, as many other apps offer this. Add these, and TrackWallet would be an easy must-have!

From all the finance trackers I have tried, this is the one that stuck to me the most. I appreciate the fact that I can transfer money externally without messing with the financial report by tracking it as an expense, which is missing in a lot of trackers. I just wish there were also a Goals/Savings tracker where you can deposit and withdraw, and Loans (Lent/Borrowed). Those would be such neat features that would make this tracker more complete! I hope you'll be able to implement them soon.

Really well organized app for local expense tracking. Compared to many bloated cloud apps out there, this is almost perfect for me. The pro version price is pretty much symbolic and totally worth it. If you need to track multiple currencies. I really like how simple it is to add a new expanse. The only thing I would improve is maybe the ability to customize the categories. But for the most part, the offered selection is fine. Edit: turns out the categories are customizable, I just missed it. <3
replyContent:
Hi there,

Thanks for feedback. You can edit categories by going to categories tab and clicking the top right edit icon

content: I have tried multiple finance tracking but this one was the most suitable for my needs. It's easy and simple to use. I just want to know if there is a way to see balance at the end of each transaction( I can only see the current balance), if not please add this functionality. Also I would love to buy the premium but the app does not describe the perks of premium anywhere. Thanks
replyContent:
Thanks for feedback!

Premium version provides cloud backup, unlimited accounts, pdf export and more. You can find the perks list on the premium purchase page.

content: It's a pretty good app, but there's one problem: the balance and transaction history are separate. I have to go back and forth just to check one. Also it would have been better if there were more widgets so we could see the balance and daily transactions instantly

I am glad I could find this app finally! This is the best I have used so far. I have tried many apps with frustrating ads popping up now and then. And I didn't even know that such features could be integrated into a simple app like TrackWallet. It deserves all stars. I am not useing the paid version yet. But am considering in near future.

The Animations, UI, icons, Usage, everything Top notch. but compared to other apps, Looks are so snapy like ios. I compared with other apps after installing around 80+ apps. 1. Auto Expense Detector from Messages 2. Link to Bank Accounts 3. Categories for Multiple Profile Accounts such as, If a person is employed and free lancer -multiple incomes, Expenses, Salaries, ETC. 4. Personal Profile - Professional Profile ( with different or default account sync ) 5. Access through Web.

One more unuseful update. Better icons, better performances, better dashboards but better nothing. Once again, I'd like to suggest NEW tools instead of layout: 1. Easy tab to duplicate expenses and incomes already registered 2. Making visible the recurring transactions in the transaction dashboard 3. Making a real-time forecast when adding new incomes or expenses even if registered in a future time 4. Accounts categorized by using groups (checking, credit cards, deposits).

Great app. I came here after my previous budget tracking app (budget bakers) started to show the ads. I love the way of adding transactions in this app where we can do it in one handed mode. Expecting this app would develop further and then I will go for the full time premium. Update - 28.5.2025 Happy with the product and went for the lifetime premium.
The app is awesome, better then the most finance softwares. But I would really like if there was possible to open on web and I miss a config for credit cards like due date

I have found issues: in credit card section total limit and available limits should not be added together. if we have different cards no option given to add them. if spent using credit cards it must not be added when card bill paid.

In my opinion and experience, this app is best for tracking expenditures and incomes. I do not use it for budgeting, so I cannot comment on its functionality for that purpose. However, it has all the functionality that eases tracking, managing and organising expenses. It is free for its basic use, does not have ads, can filter according to categories, allows you to adjust the cycling period to start and end at a date that suits your spending trend.

Okay I did see now that you can set transactions to repeat every set number amount of days, weeks, months, etc. I thought it meant repeat that many times within the week (etc). Thank you. A feature that would be nice is a separate tab that shows the future impact of your accounts based on the recurring transactions you have set up. Otherwise great app! üíØ
replyContent: You can already set recurring transactions to happen every 2 weeks in the app.

content: The app is great, paid for premium which is super cheap right now, may pay for lifetime to be honest. I have two things I wish for in order get give 5 stars. 1) More icons and colors - I'm color blind so similar colors to me are kind of hard to see and tell the difference for each category. 2) I would love to have a hold option, something that tells me that I paid for it, but hasn't gone thru the bank yet. (Example - Checks and verifications. Once it goes thru, you can come back and click OK)

Great app, but there's one minor annoyance for me: there isn't an option to merge/move a single subcategory into a different main category, which is a little annoying but hasn't affected me much yet, since I've only added expenses for one month so far. However, I can see how this limitation could become a significant issue if I had a larger dataset, like a year's worth of expenses.
replyContent: Hi Kabir, thanks for feedback. You can always convert the subcategory to category and then convert it back to subcategory.

content: One of the best apps for expense tracking that I've used. It's very minimal but with a lot of utility within it to manage your expenses and keep everything simple. I'm able to make multiple accounts to sort my money with different currencies. I'm also able to make personal categories to sort my expenses. 2 things will make this THE BEST app ever 1. More icons for personal categories. 2. OCR Receipt scan to auto sort based on receipt scanned. (Edited)
replyContent: Thank you for providing valuable feedback. In regards to your second suggestion, you can press on a note icon in the transaction keyboard to add notes for your transactions.

content: Just like I wanted - could add multiple accounts. Not only easy to manage but also in love with the layout and simplistic design of the app (dark theme üòç). One disadvantage I would like to point out is that there should be more categories for income and not just limited to salary. Other than that, I have nothing else to complain about. Edit: 5 stars! Thank you developer for the fast response and yes, you can add categories (subcategories too) but very limited.
replyContent: Hey thanks ü´Ç! You can create your own categories for income/expense and delete those that you don't need. Although there's a limit for sum of all categories for free users!

content: Amazing app, does everything that I need, but one suggestion. On the total balance screen, in the amount on the left hand side, is there any way we could have the option to put the currency at the beginning, so instead of 10¬£, give the option to have ¬£10. It works in all other sections, apart from the chart on total balance. Apart from that, flawless

I've searched long and far for a good spending tracking app. Let me tell you, this hits all the points that all other apps lack. I can't write all of this in a review, but it has everything I could ask for, and it's for free. There is a $9.99 option to pay for full access--that's if you want to put in unlimited accounts. Since I love this app, that's a very reasonable price and worth it. Something I love about this app is the interface and so many options to customize transactions. üëçüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

The one-time purchase of the premium version of the app is definitely worth it! I am new to adulting/budgeting. I like to categorize my expenses and income by hand, no hassle like other apps to sync to a bank account only for it to have connectivity issues. I can see how much I am spending or raking in per month. With premium, you can save to the cloud (manually do it), and export data into a file. This is the best app! I recommend the premium version of this app. Easy to use! Beginner-Friendly!

Tracking expenses and income with this app. Best app for me. However, budget transactions do not appear. Good for tracking income and expenses, still need work on the budgeting part. Something I would like is that all of the icons can be used. (Example: Icons afor accounts and icons for categories are separate.) I have an account that I'm saving for a future car and would like to use the car icon, but I can't since they are separate.

This is a really good app. Keeping track of expenses etc is fantastic. The only thing missing is being able to set or forecast expected costs for the various categories and subcategories, then tracking spend against those amounts. So if I estimate that I'll spend ¬£100 on groceries, I can see how much I spend against how much I budgeted to spend. Feature request!

It's easy to use and I love the interface of the app. however I would like it if I can be able to set a goal of amount I want to save in account with track of it. and setting budget it doesn't show how much you spent and how much remains and I use premium. I don't see big difference In free account and paid membership. other than those I love the display and I hope you will add more features.

Loved the app so much, bought the lifetime licence after only a day or so of downloading it. Two things would enhance the UEx. Firstly being able to duplicate an existing transaction to a new transaction. Secondly, being able to mark a transaction as Reconciled, for when checking against a bank statement. Other than that it's pretty much perfect.
Hey guys great app bought the premium on the third day everything I was looking for in an app. Would love if in the budget tab we could selectively delete some entries not entire categories.

This app looks good but there is some missing features. Add transaction button should be on home also, means on all section is good. exporting data does not work, app crashes in my samsung. No option of importing data. Hope Fixing will come soon
Good app, unable to restore data across devices bought lifetime access. No simple way to log in and out of account

Like the clean UI and the ability to add various accounts! A feature I'd like to see in future versions is the ability to add sub-categories or tags (for example, within Food I might want to have sub-categories for Snacks, Drinks, Alcohol, etc.). But looking good so far, I like the direction this app is headed towards!
replyContent: Subcategories available on latest app version.

content: i had a subscription based trackwallet app . first of all I take back up my income , expenses and so on . delete the app . and reinstall the app then I try to retrieve back up data it didn't back up data .......
Is it possible to add a search bar to subcategories when adding expense? It would be convenient because i have a lot of subcategories and it would be easier to find.
Trackwallet is fantastic! I've tried many expense trackers, but this one's UI and UX are perfectly intuitive. Finally, an app that just works for me.
This application is extremely beneficial for managing my costs, budget, and accounts. I have opted for the premium version to effectively handle my financial reports.

Great expense tracker! Super clean and minimal, with all of the information you need right up front and not hidden behind submenus or long scrolls. One feature that I wish TrackWallet had is the ability to search for Categories when entering a transaction. I often forget which "parent" the "child" category I want is in, which makes it pretty time consuming to enter in a once-in-a-blue-moon expense.

I use this for my business because I also track the sales of my business and the expenses in this app really helpful exactly what I want and I can even change the starting day of the month as it is it varies in my country Nepal

Almost perfect. I wish there was a way to add a note to expenses, rather than just tagging them to a category. For instance, if I have 2 different vehicle insurances, I would like to use the insurance category I have setup for both, but make a note on each expense which insurance company that expense is associated with
replyContent:
Hi Luke,
You can add notes when creating transaction, there is a button called 'Add note' under the amount and above category selection.

content: excellent app can you please include options to round the cash to the nearest internet, and add more cards? i like the interface very much, it's an excellent app so far bought lifetime
Best expense tracking / finance management app out there. Buying the premium version was absolutely worth it!
I‚Äôve been using the Trackwallet app for a while now, and I truly appreciate the features and simplicity it offers. It‚Äôs been a great help in managing my finances more effectively.

I've installed any money/expense tracker more than 10years and found this apps recently due to my old app reporting wasn't detail. Currently the best one I've had. Nothing is perfect, bit hard when I've many wallets, need to select the particular wallet/credit when input then transaction. So I always input from the dashboard wallet > transaction form due to auto select the exact wallet instead of transaction page with (+) button. It seems the (+) button on the transaction page useless. But OK.

The best budget app so far after checking out almost all of budget app in the play store. UI is amazing and very clean. Easy to navigate and add transactions. It's perfect. I found everything I need in this app. Just a few suggestions, please add "Goals/Savings" feature and bills or recurring transactions reminder before it be added to transactions. So that it won't be added automatically to expenses even if it hasn't been paid yet. Thank you.
Have Used the Free Version .Now Using the Paid Version money is well spend rather then maintaining a excel sheet this is much better.Very Organized Expense Manager
Best wallet tracking app by far. Worth paying for premium. Love the look. Good job, guys.

Looks good, quick to add transactions, nice features. The budget feature is cool, mostly because it tells you how much you can spend per day. What is missing and is extremely important is selecting multiple transactions at the same time in order to delete them. Also it'd be nice if you could also have a note tab.

Best app to keep track of expenses! Excellent UI easy to use no fancy features and no ads even in free version! I don't understand why this app is so low in search list. I have tried so many others from the top results but those were just bloated apps with ads and trackers and not worth it or doesn't live up to the taste. Edit - Missing 1 star reverted!
replyContent: Hi, thank you! If you have the time, please let me know at contact@ninthfi.pw what was missing to get 5 stars.

content: I need to be able to mark out (not delete) some items I added and see how much that would save me, you know... like an actual BUDGETING process!!! Also where is the upload CSV? And in transactions, the name (notes) of each item e.g onions, should be more important (as the heading) with it's category, food, being the smaller text. This helps better in differentiation of the food & drinks items on my transaction list.

This is hands down the best manual expenses tracker that I have used and it's always being updated! Here is a tip for anyone who sees this comment and owns a Samsung Galaxy. You can use Bixby routines to await a notification from one of your banking apps when a transaction is made, you can then pick TrackWallet to open either the app instantly or better yet, you can pick the shortcut to add the transaction ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. I can't wait to see what's next for this app ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Reduced to 3 stars as the more I explore, more I miss features below. Few suggestions: quick add transacton button on each screen instead of just the transactions tab. Have an easy view of upcoming transactions instead of opening up the recurring transactions tab. Swipe across the tabs rather than clicking through them at the bottom. Have the option on scheduling transactions over next business date if the scheduled date happens to be weekend. A great app though!!!

content: Will be great if I can select more than one category and the amount will split accordingly. thanks!

If, however, it was shown as recurring in thirty or forty years, it would be realistic, either as a future house upgrade or renovation. Similarly, five and ten year options would cover major appliances and air conditioners.
replyContent: Hey! Thanks for leaving your review. Could you contact me at ninthfi@gmail.com for further details on your feature request? So I could better understand it.

content: Better than many expense trackers.The detailed options are pretty customizable. This is what makes the app unique.
Totally fake. I tried to enter amount it's so complicated. It's wast of time and money.
replyContent: TrackWallet is designed to be simple, but I understand it might not work for everyone. If you have any specific feedback on what felt difficult, I‚Äôd love to improve it. Let me know: contact@trackwallet.app

content: Great expense tracker. After trying all apps to track my expenses, this app is the best so far for me. However, please add functionality to manage loans, and ability to change logo of an account by uploading custom icon. I will give 5 stars if those two are available.

The app has been very helpful in tracking all income and expenses. It would be great if you could create categories under accounts - this would help to track income and expenses by category, eg: balance from all savings bank, all cards, or by all investments. Thanks.

Amazing UI. Love the simplicity, and it still gets the job done. The upgrade is less than $30, AND it's a one-time fee. THANK YOU!! If nothing else swayed me, it was the fact I didn't have to subscribe to unlock the paywall.

I upgraded to the pro version of the app. And it was great. But just lost my phone yesterday. After buying a new phone and reinstalling the app, my data can still not be found. Pls can you do this so we can periodically back up info in Google drive or do you have a web version? I want to track my assets and liabilities. I had to use two apps and feed information from this app into another app. Can you do it so we can finally updated and get Assets, Liabilities and Net Worth as part?
replyContent:
Hi Francis,
Automatic backup is available when you sign in with your Google or TrackWallet account.

Go to the dashboard and press the cloud icon at the top right. After signing in you will see an option to enable auto backup.

content: Loving this tool so much, Just migrated from a different tool and find this as a good replacement. Nice and clean layout, I'm on monthly subs to see how far this app goes. Would be so much better if multi currency account is possible. Will add another star if it's fixed and if you guys can add investment tracker

Perfect app for expense tracking. Does not show any kind of ads even when its free and it asks for a very reasonable cost to support the developer (which I have done now) if you would wish to. Wish there was an import feature to import and expense list CSV file from a prior version of the app.

I mailed you to add the calculator feature. I dont know wheter u considered that. But i am happy that it got added.. Thank u so much. I have another suggestion too. Opening app everytime and adding an expense really sucks. It would be great if you add a simple 1*1 widget through which we can directly add income or expense. P.S. Thank u for adding the widget. I am glad that u r responding so quickly !!!
replyContent: Hey! Thanks for review, I'll add the widget on upcoming updates. Meanwhile starting from Android 7 you can hold the app icon and a shortcut pops up. It might not be visible on some custom launchers though. EDIT: I actually added this feature in today's update!

content: So far I am impressed with how the application looks, feels and functions. Simple with just enough icons, colors and splendid charts to give a visual aide to help visualize the numbers. Customization of Categories is by fast the best out of the other competition. A web version would be helpful in the future.

It does almost everything to a daily use. I only wanted to have an import option, it could be in the same CSV format as the export option, so we could start with historic data. That would be a 5 stars. Anyway it really worth the subscription. I'm doing lifetime as I'm sure I will use this app for more than a couple of years. Keep doing a good job guys!

I'd suggest though you add haptic feedback to the number keys in the transaction pop-up; more widgets to display, for example, budget, categories, etc; app-lock when leaving the app minimized and resuming it after some time.

I tried several other apps in the past that have the same purpose. The only downside of those apps is that they don't have the option to see your multiple finance options, so that means you can only see your income and expenses as a single answer, where this one has options as towards where the source where it's being received and handled. For anyone that wants an accurate record of how your finance is working, then this app is definitely for you.

I really liked the app but it doesn't allow us to add tags or labels to the expenses/ transactions and also doesn't allow us to attach receipts images to the transaction. All the other apps have both of these options. Tags would be helpful in filtering related transactions and receipts would be helpful to see more details.

Also, additional exports to formats like .xlsx and .pdf would have been more helpful. Overall a very good experience with this app.
replyContent: .pdf exports and more notification settings are on my list for upcoming updates. Thanks üëç

content: Best expense tracking app and I would recommend to everyone since the free version doesn't contain any Ads and most importantly it is user friendly, much clear with categories and sub-categories. replyContent: Thank you for supporting development ‚ò∫Ô∏è

content: I've started recently using your app and it's great. This is the first app purchase I've done in my life. But I would like to request app features. 1- Adding another level of sub categories (Sub sub categories). This is specially useful if you want to budget as you'll start with Fixed and variable costs then level 2 is sub categories and level 3 should be another categories of sub categories. Example: fixed costs -> Car (this is where the app stops) -> fuel or maintenance, etc..

The app is great. I would like to make few suggestion tho. There should instructions added to explain app features, the app is simple but I didn't how to remove templates until I contacted support. I have subscribed monthly but If I want to change to yearly it seems I have to unsubscribe first, an option to update payments preference should be added in the app. Also If you could add a section for investements that would be great

replyContent: Hi, thanks for trying out the app. You can create budgets for different categories and subcategories by going to Insights tab and then selecting budgets on top. Also you can track different bank accounts and cash spendings on order to see an overall picture of your finances. Unfortunately the carry over budget feature is currently not released.

content: Selecting categories and subcategories are really difficult when we have multiple items, you need to scroll and pick right one which gets more and more difficult when the number of items increase, Another disadvantage is ,unable to carry forward budget or unable to get the net budget accross multiple months. Transaction entry screen is not user friendly, save button has to be in bottom for easy access Definitely lot of scope for improvement,all the best

I've used Wallet by Budget Bakers and Money Manager by Real Byte for over 5 years and both are considered the best but Track Wallet is significantly better. It's simpler, cleaner, and I use every feature it offers because they're well integrated and purposeful compared to the other two. A good developer can't be underestimated and I can assure you Track Wallet has one. Download this app.

Found an annoying bug preventing me from using this app. Set the main currency USD and add two incomes: +$10 and +‚Ç¨10 (= $10.78). Then change the main currency to EUR. Whether you keep or update currency rates, the first transaction will be converted to +‚Ç¨10 (=$10). In other words, currency rates will be ignored and 1:1 rate will be used instead. And it will be shown "‚Ç¨20" total income in the cash flow, and it's definitely wrong

It's an excellent app for tracking expenses and income. Transactions entry is easy and very fast keeping memory of similar previous entries' notes. content: Love using this app. Very clean UI and intuitive. I wish we could also attach photos to transactions as sometimes I would like to go back to view receipts for a particular charge. Hi!
You can create recurring transactions by going to Transaction tab and clicking on the top right button that looks like a clock.

content: Maybe I didn't explore your app enough, didn't realise it has the premium optionüòÜ Sure, soon I will opt for the premium subscription as I really think this app deserve it! replyContent: Hi Arin, thanks for your feedback. Backup currently works like this: Premium users can use email/Google account to sign in to the TrackWallet app, after that you will see data backup options. When you press ‚ÄòBackup‚Äô the data on the device is uploaded to the cloud so that you can later press ‚ÄòRestore‚Äô on other devices and have it back.

content: I have been using this app for more than 8 months now and this app is been a life saver for me and I have recommended this for 3 people and all the 3 people are using it now and they all are happy with the experience. content: Love it! My only suggestion would be the ability to label each transaction, such as "Petsmart shopping" or "Amazon Purchase" for example, to better organize and keep track of transactions! :)

content: Smooth, functional and so helpful to track daily purchases and saving. After a few months, I have decided to go with the premium package and will use it as my main tracking one. Hope the dev will continue to maintain/update the app with more amazing features.

content: This app is amazing, it has various categories and helps me analyze my expenses. I have used various apps to track and maintain my budget, trust me this one is best.
